name: Potter Park Zoo
address: 1301 S Pennsylvania Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: This place is wonderful! Located in a beautiful area right on the river trail. Admission is very affordable and we had a blast even though some of the animals were inside for the winter.

Perfect little zoo day! My son picked Potter Zoo for his birthday outing. He Spent the day exploring animals and riding the train with family and friends. He explored the gift shop and managed to con us into ice cream mid afternoon. He loved the petting area and the horse ride! (Which made for the best photos) He enjoyed watching the monkeys and even rolling down the entrance hill. Would definitely recommend for littles!

We had the good fortune to visit this nice little Zoo last weekend.

As a lifetime animal lover, I generally prefer smaller zoos. Although they don't have as much as larger zoos, you can usually get closer to the animals.

This zoo is set in a beautiful wooded area. There's plenty of parking and even on a Saturday afternoon, it was never crowded, which is a great selling point.

Our favorite exhibit was the Tamarinds. Small white topped monkeys with some babies. Adorable, although I didn't get any pictures of them.

The otter was a lot of fun too, swimming back and forth to the delight of us all. The lions, although napping through the heat of the day were beautiful. The rhinoceros is a very majestic creature. 

Exceptionally pleasant day visiting such a nice zoo.
A hidden gem of the Lansing area, amazing large zoo with lots of unique and exciting animals! Great location for a date
Small family friendly zoo with some big animals. There a great selection of animals from amphibians to tigers a great place. We went for the lights in December awesome experience.

name: Michigan History Center
address: 702 W Kalamazoo St, Lansing, MI 48915, USA
reviews: This place was very educational, very clean and contained a ton of information and items. My only issue, if I had to be picky would be navigating all the floors. Not all elevators took you to all floors, and we didn't see any signs directing us to a different elevator for the other content. We missed the top floor because the elevator we were at didn't seem to take us there and we didn't know where the other one was. I have a knee injury and the stairs weren't an option that day. Small signs might be useful to navigate. I didn't notice any if there were any. Gift store was also really well put together. Thank you for having us!!
MHC is well organized!  I have lived in Michigan all my life and there is plenty of history I do not know about. AMAZING!!! It is for ALL ages!!!

This is a true gem in the Lansing area.  I have grown up going to this museum as often as I could and I still go whenever I get a chance.  Every time I visit I see something new.  Whether it's an ever changing special exhibit or just letting the permanent displays take you back in time to when Michigan was number one in all the land, this place has something for everyone.  Please take a trip if you have never been or if you have go back.  It's well worth any drive you have to make and it's free!
I always have a blast... I have been going there since I was really little. And now I have brought all of children there, youngest love and she's only 3 years old.
Love this place! The secret life of Michigan objects is a must see! I also love the Union Hall exhibit!

name: Hawk Island Park
address: 1601 E Cavanaugh Rd, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: If it’s a fresh snow be prepared to wait, definitely worth it though. They give you a group number and when they call your number you get 2 hours on the hill. Bring cards/games for the wait, they have picnic tables inside and it’s heated. No walking up the hill they have a motorized lift!! SO FUN!!

One of the beautiful place to walk in summer. Quiet place and has lot of trails to walk and bike. Kids have play area. Adults can play volleyball and barbecues. Good play for picnics in summer. During winter you can find tube sliding.

Beautiful area for a simple stroll around the lake and in the forest as well as for its summer and winter activities. There is something for everyone here, from the swimming /splash park for the little ones in the summer to the tube rides on the snow in the winter, complete with a dog park and covered picnic tables. Plenty of parking and the regular entry fee for Lansing's parks, 3$ for Ingham county residents.

Had a great time at Hawk Island! Had to wait in the lodge for roughly 2 hours, so be prepared for that. But when its your turn, you get 2 hours of unlimited sledding, and tubes are included. Will be going back again next year!

It's definitely a typical township park worth to try if you are nearby. Free if you're biking but some fees apply coming by car. Splash Park and wooden playground are well built and kept. You  an bring your own food but concessions are available. With exception of the beach, there are plenty of shaded areas but not so many trees. You can rent a kayak or bring your own too.

name: R.E. Olds Transportation Museum
address: 240 Museum Dr, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Fun museum in Michigan! My wife and I came by mid day during the week to check out the cars here. Definitely a place to spend an hour or two.
Great place. Really shows the history of the family and the auto industry. Beautiful cars and other antiques. Certainly worth stopping in and checking it out.
Very cute, quiet little museum,  i had no idea even existed! It was a wonderful experience.

Stopped here on our visit to Lansing. $15 for the family (four of us) for us to tour the museum. Mr R. E. Olds meets you as you walk in (well this statue does). Several models on display and the boys enjoyed walking about looking at the cars and at least a couple of trucks as well.  We went on a Saturday late morning/early afternoon and there wasn't too many people here.
A great place to learn about some of Lansings history. Also learned a lot about RE Olds who is a fascinating person

name: Michigan Princess Riverboat
address: Grand River Park, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews:
Great experience with wedding on boat and travel through the river. Smooth operation.
Could have been a little more discrete in service.
Wonderful lighting- also 1/4 of the lights did not light up properly. Kind of drove me crazy for a little bit.
What a lovely boat in Lansing! I went on the summer brews cruise and it was fantastic. A great way to spend a Michigan summer evening.
It was the most amazing thing I have ever done.  It was special to me because of my escort & the amazing Captain ( owner). I felt like I was in heaven. Would love to go again
So enjoyable! The food was awesome! A Thanksgiving Feast was served with all the trimmings. The Captain gave us a wonderful history about the Riverboat. And the view was beautiful!
Fun afternoon on Grand river in Lansing. Go every year with bus tour groups. Good meal, friendly staff. Going to their Detroit boat this summer

name: Impression 5 Science Center
address: 200 Museum Dr, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Really awesome place for kids and adults. This place doesn't seem very big upon entering but when you go upstairs it's huge! There are so many fun activities you can literally spend a whole day here and still probably not get to everything. Definitely would go back if I'm in the area again.

A great place to explore and discover. There are lots of hands-on demonstrations and activities for kids to try out, each offering a fun and intuitive introduction to a scientific concept.

I don't know that the features rotate or get updated often, so it's not likely a place to return to frequently. But I highly recommend it to anyone who hasn't been before.

A downside to many locations in this area is that lunch options can be sparse on the weekends.

Took two 5 year old boys here for a few hours. They LOVED it!!! Their votes on most fun stations: paper air plane throwing machine, playing with water, and the catapult throwing. The admission fee is not unreasonable and it was not too busy so they were able to play with everything.

From the bubbles, to the teeth, to the water room. There is something for all ages and stages. The hands on learning is amazing. Dont forget to pop into the gift shop and get some souvenirs. These Crazy Aaron's thinking putty is super fun for all ages and comes in hundreds of colors, varieties, and sizes. You cant lose by supporting an outstanding company like Crazy Aaron's after a fun filled day at Impressions 5.

My 6 year old son just had a blast with his school trip. They keep the place clean and neat for sure and making the slime was terrific. The instructor had incredible patience with the class. Props to him. Great time. Definitely planning to go again!

name: Fenner Nature Center
address: 2020 E Mt Hope Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: My family loves to hike the trails at Fenner! I appreciate that there’s paved trails that are perfect for shorter hikes with less stable walkers, as well as dirt trails if you want to get more adventurous. We also enjoy the festivals and never miss the maple syrup festival.
A nice variety of trails and Nature Center. The trails go through several different types of habitats were different Wildlife can be spotted.
Early Morning Snow Burst during the walk. Took the longest Route to enjoy the serenity. Seen several deer watching us.

I love this Center for many reasons. Besides being a treasure in our city. It's a little slice of a Woods in the middle of the city. They also have an Apple Butter Festival. Which I love. Hey have docents there that when I bring my students on a field trip they have many activities to help each age level. The Apple Butter Festival is for family and individuals. Which is a must-do. I also love the maple syrup Festival. You must come and walk amongst the trees. Go to the observation room and look at the birds being fed with all of the different bird feeders. See the lovely bees buzzing and an actual window into the hive is quite an attraction for young and old. They also have feathers and different species to show to the visitors.
Wonderful park with a Savannah and well kept walkways. You can get in a good hike here. There are a number of trails. Fishing piers too. Plus a nature center building with things for kids.

name: Crego Park
address: 1600 Fidelity Road,, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: I'm SO glad this is again open to the public.  I wasn't in Lansing when it closed, but I hear there was an environmental reason that it had to be closed maybe 25 years ago. Now? It's this wonderful freshwater lake stocked with fish with an accessible kayak launch and a challenging trail around it. Bring your camera! If the light is just right, the trees on the far side of the lake are mirrored in the water and it's just lovely! Try accessing Crego Park from the River Trail, too! The back way in is much more scenic.
Nice park!! Short walk to old coal railway station. Awesome to see something like that up close!!
I come here for early morning bike rides all the time. It's a beautiful spot to watch the sunrise and enjoy nature
Beautiful scenery and well taken care of path ways(minus along some of the pond area). Nice dock for setting kayaks or canoes in(wheel chair accessible), well kept pier.
Nice lake. Great for kids to fish. Kayakers were in and out. Overall, good place to picnic and have some family time.

name: Adado Riverfront Park
address: 201 E Shiawassee St, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: I love all Lansing parks, we are blessed to be surrounded by so much nature. Visually and mentally stimulating. I ride bikes thought the parks in the summer, very relaxing
Nice walk next to the river.  1.5 mile walk around. It's well maintained with a handicap john.  The trail is well kept with the path half asphalt and the other side more woodsy feel.
Along the river trail. Nice large open area for frisbee or kite flying.

Showcase of downtown Lansing with big event center, farmers market, Lug nuts stadium featuring both baseball and socker.      New beach popular with those enjoy outdoor 🌞 fun.  A few parts of our downtown area.

Flashy, money consuming, but pleasant, and it sets the mood because all I can see is a place where you visit for a luxury vacation without the Hassel of travel plus expenses. I would prefer the same look in my backyard without the Grand River.

name: Michigan 4-H Children's Garden
address: 1066 Bogue St, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: I love this place. Peaceful and fun. Very child friendly

What a hidden gem! A tiny hedge maze, an ampitheater, a story walk, lots of cool plants including one that smells like popcorn, a beautiful bride under a weeping willow ... 
And the details are all there. For example at first you just notice the colorful crayon shaped posts on the fence. Upon closer inspection, you'll see that the name of each crayon is a flower that matches the color. And then you'll notice that the same flower is planted at the base of each respective post. 
Throughout the garden there are well tended details like that which really elevate the experience. This isn't a cheaply thrown-together thing. This is well thought out and cared for, and it shows.
Very cool place for the local kids.  So many learning opportunities.  The staff here are so very nice and patient.
This park is awesome, so many thing kids get to learn during visiting here.

I have never been here before and didn't even know it existed! Found it by accident while looking for the butterfly house at MSU. Wow! I could post a bazillion pictures, but I won't 😉 We  were there in late August. More butterflies than I've ever seen in one place! And hummingbirds were everywhere! It was great!

name: W.J. Beal Botanical Garden
address: W Circle Dr, East Lansing, MI 48824, USA
reviews: This is one of the Oldest Botanical gardens in the United States. A living classroom of nature, many different species of plant life.

If you're interested in plants you can grow in Michigan, what their uses and their histories, this is a great place to visit. Beautiful grounds, lots of information and friendly and interactive volunteers.
Beautiful and peaceful setting on the MSU campus. Plan to return in a few weeks to see what else has bloomed!!  Great selection of perennials and edible plants.
A beautiful place to walk through-family and kid friendly.
Quite place. Nice atmosphere. If your a plant and flower hobbyist you'll like this place.

name: Abrams Planetarium
address: 755 Science Rd, East Lansing, MI 48824, USA
reviews: The Abrams Planetarium is a great planetarium located at Michigan State University. It's small, but there is still enough to see and do. They have different shows and exhibits going on periodically. I have seen some interesting exhibits there including comets, planets, etc. They have the Imax type shows where they screen the film on the ceiling in the auditorium. It's really cool. There is a gift shop too. Definitely make a stop at the planetarium sometime!

Cheap and interesting displays, which can be fun with friends or family.  Some nights they have special shows which can be really fun. 

Also the home of the moist towelette museum.
Family Fun. Loved the show.

We will definitely be going back! Great for adults and kids and better than 3D! See what is in our night sky.  Great end show tribute to MSU with fireworks could not be happier and for a reasonable price.  Thanks for a wonderful afternoon 😍
Do you still have the Moist Towelette Museum there?

name: Eli and Edythe Broad Art Museum at Michigan State University
address: 547 E Circle Dr, East Lansing, MI 48824, USA
reviews:
It's art, ok? You just wouldn't get it. 
This enormous modern architectural eye sore is placed right in the middle of old campus completely ruining the aesthetic of its surroundings. 
Conveniently placed next to the RCAH (Residential College for Air Heads) it is home to a revolving exhibit of modern art masterpieces like a lone chair placed in the middle of an empty room. 
This is the sort of building I would only wish upon my most detested enemy.

Beautiful building with thoughtfully designed and very creative architecture. Admission is free. There are several smaller galleries that appear to change out art on a regular basis. We spent about an hour here. After the art museum we went to the MSU Dairy Store (in Anthony Hall) to get ice cream. These places made for a nice excursion with two teenagers.

We overcame the lack of exterior beauty hoping for something good inside, but were utterly disappointed. A small and uninteresting temporary exhibit, stairs going up displaying a "mature content" sign. I inquired and was told there is NO permanent collection. Best  they could do for us was to point to a glass window through which we could glimpse at the archived items. I wonder about alumni wanting to revisit the classic works from the old museum of their college days. In other college towns we have lived. we enjoyed taking kids and company to look at art and history from each state, along with interesting perdocidcal special exhibits. Utterly disappointed.
Great spot to take a break and clear your mind and a v nice Starbucks location to work from if you’re in this area of campus.
Nice University universal art museum with indie feel. Be sure to check out the active maker space across the street.

name: MSU Horticulture Gardens
address: 1066 Bogue St, East Lansing, MI 48824, USA
reviews: It's a wonderful garden ❤️ I loved the place too❤️ I want to go back to her again😍
I went to the annual orchid show. It was spectacular, as usual. Here is the orchid I purchased.
Beautiful and well kept, has amazing flowers and our guide was amazing. Went for a school thing.
Went to the Greater Lansing Orchid show.  It was a wonderful time
A very nice horticulture garden. A must visit place if you are visiting Michigan State University and love flowers.

name: Remembrance Memorial
address: 100 N Grand Ave, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Sad part of history but the brave us soldiers and ect did a good job.. Peaceful next to the river with so much pain seeing those people fall to their doom.. I use to smoke down by there and the river
Even after all these years, its still nice to remember.
Great little 9/11 memorial piece in a nice park
Convenient and quiet alternative to CATA CTC.

name: Grand Woods Park
address: Grand Woods Park Dr, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Nice park with some open spaces and pavilions. Most trails are not paved. Disc golf course was nice, although could be better marked.

We took a nice Fall stroll through the park. I was surprised to find how large it was and how well mapped out ! The disc golf course is well marked and looks like lots of fun ! The views are wonderful with a trail along the river and also a large pond . Pavilions are available for rent and playground equipment is maintained . The only disappointment is that there is no bathroom facility. It is always locked. Cross country runners often use the trails and dog walkers are frequently seen . So put on your walking shoes and get out there !
Nice big park. Moderately maintained. Many disc golfers there everytime I have been. There is an RC car track here. Picnic tables and gazebos are in good condition.
Pretty good disc golf course
Great disc golf course and awesome scenery....bring your shorts because lots of water shots and I refuse to leave a disc behind..in fact found a few diggin for mine will be back soon

name: Durant Park
address: 700 N Capitol Ave, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: A very quiet park in the middle of the city. While this park is pretty well attended with children, families and seniors walking, its well.maintained and has a very nice flower area.  It Was a nice place to just sit , relax , talk and play a game. Most enjoyable time
The park is a lovely escape for anybody who is a nature lover.

The colorful Adirondack chairs you can place for your preference, beauty, mature trees, uncrowded, clean ...
The swings are perfect!! Wide enough, high enough for this bike riding granny to remember being a kid and make a good summer 2019 memory in Lansing
I'm glad that it is well maintained and hope that it remains for many,many years to come.
Very nice place in the summertime plenty of trees around to shade you very comfortable in the springtime and very comfortable in the very cold in the winter time

name: Michigan State Capitol
address: 100 N Capitol Ave, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Super wonderful place I recommend every citizen in Michigan to go see it. no matter how much I describe it you gotta see it by your eyes. wonderful historical building and the work was done is amazing. My photos can tell a small part.

I enjoyed a self guided tour of the Michigan State Capitol building yesterday and cannot wait to go back!! This building is a treasure within Lansing that should be seen by everyone! It is free to tour and an incredible experience in itself!! The pictures will not do this building justice!! Go see it as soon as you can!!!

Almost a personal tour on the day we visited.  We were here collecting another stamp for the boys passports (all State capitals). We arrived just before the tour started and were the only ones when it started (late afternoon on a Friday). 
Always like the tours as you get more info and history about the capital and state. For instance, it's easy to b forget that Michigan was once on a border with an enemy (war of 1812) and the capital was Detroit at that time and had been captured. 
We had a good time moving about the capital building and learning as we moved along.
A wonderful place to watch  how laws are made and society is ran. Also a goldmine for Michigan History,  which we all love.
In my opinion, the most beautiful building in Lansing. When I arrived the whole city seemed dead. Cool stop if you are passingg through, but i would not make Lansing a getaway place for the weekend

name: Frances Park
address: Lansing, MI 48911, USA
reviews: Beautifully landscaped and well-maintained public gardens.  Nice overlook of the Grand River.  Clean, safe.  Free parking.  A great place for a leisurely stroll.

We visited this place as a recommendation for Senior pictures for our son. I have to say, THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! It's absolutely beautiful and very well kept. There are many different backdrops that you can use for pictures of any occasion.  While we were there, there was a couple getting engagement pictures taken and also Homecoming pictures for a group of students. I highly recommend this park!!

It's a well kept place. Great for a nice walk.
There were kids playing, an event with nice music. A couple taking pictures.
What a great gift left for the community

Paved walking trail, beautiful gardens, huge expanse of open lawn, large enclosed events building, clean restrooms, large playground. Rose gardens would be a great spot for a wedding, or just take a leisurely walk. These are only a few of the the highlights of this Lansing gem.
A beautiful, we maintained area. Especially the Rose garden.

name: Granger Meadows Park
address: 1745 Granger Meadows Ln, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: This is one of our favorite places to speed in the winter. Good times!

This is my second time here really enjoy it peace and quiet sitting underneath a nice shade tree relaxing taking it all in listening to the birds...
But I do smell a little trash when the wind blows from the Granger dump not far from here..

This park is great. The path around it is perfect for walking/running and has climbs and descents. The basketball courts and jungle gym offer hours of fun. The area would be ideal for celebrations too! I look forward to going back again very soon!
Snow hill was fun...
It's a good park, with trails and play equipment, pavilions for parties and gatherings. My kids love coming here.

name: Scott Woods Park
address: 2605 Clifton Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Beautiful woods, flora, waterways,  and serene walkways.

A small park that allows access to the Lansing River Trail and Hawk Island. Free to park but the lot is small. There is play structure and small swing set (1 infant swing 1 standard swing). 4 stars only because there are sometimes bees or similar around the play structure which is not to say that surprises me at an outdoor park but it does limit my ability to let my child play there at times / fyi be prepared. I met some nice people on the trail that showed me this jack in the pulpit last night. There were also some may apples a bit farther in but I did not want disturb the area around them to get a photo.
It's a great walk if you make time for it. McGuire park, hawk island, and Scott's wood are all next to each other.
Nice place to walk or bike. Trails lead into hawk island as well if you want a longer walk. Small parking lot, small pavillion and a playground at the entrance to the trails.
If you want to get in touch with nature this is one of the places in Lansing you can enjoy a good walk

name: Meridian Historical Village
address: 5151 Marsh Rd, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews: This is a great place to take a walk back in time (literally!) and see some local history. The Meridian Historical Village is very scenic and a nice place to think. Consider bringing your camera, even if the insides of the buildings are closed to the public, there’s still much that may catch your eye. Check out their pond and gazebo by the water, too!

I went with my son for his school field trip,  Meridian Historical Village is a amazing historic of the people lived during 1850s and toll road people. My son and I have a wonderful time in the perfect weather, each building have an amazing story to share. Only public restroom at old school during operation hour, wheelchairs accessible and no free wifi. Great place for walk and there's picnic tables.
You step back in time when you enter the village. And the docette are very knowledgeable.
Nice evening stroll, clean park
Absolutely gorgeous. I was here for a wedding and loved it. I will definitely be going back.

name: Moores Park
address: Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: One of the best parks in Lansing.  Large, lots of different attractions to offer including a labyrinth, soccer and basketball courts, fishing, swimming pool, picnic benches, bathrooms, trails for hiking and biking, and natural beauty.  If you cross the bridge and walk past the river it takes you to the heart of REO Town, and the trails connect you to the Lansing River Trail.
Big green space, fun places to walk and cool things to photograph. Adjacent parking.
Relaxing place to unwind .fish or just enjoy the river walk
Its def a nice park 2 take the kids, they have alil 4 everyone in the family:) Along the water so just beautiful 2 look at even! Definitely a nice place 2 check out with the family!
There pool is a hidden gem of Lansing. Rough neighborhood, great historic pool.

name: Anderson Nature Park
address: 3301-, 3377 Wardell Rd, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews: Beautiful lake. Dirt trails. Bike trail. Great time.
Had a great time walking around great trails... wanna cone back with a bike.. looks like alot of fun
Went there and walked the bike trails! It was super nice! Also a good place to look for morel mushrooms! At one part there is a very small sand beach!

Very woodsy area with dense foliage. Caters to mountain biking and hiking.  It has many steep hills and no pavement. Prepare for a work  out if you go here and bring your own water. There are no facilities here. However,  I spied an park office on Old Lansing Rd as I left the park. I am not sure whether the office had regular hours or staffing.
Pretty,quiet little park. 6 miles of trails for your hiking, running, biking needs:)

name: John M. Patriarche Park
address: 960 Alton Street, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: A good time for kids of all ages. See the pictures. Playground, baseball fields, picnic tables, grills, necessary room facilities. They could probably use more parking, but for the most part it seems adequate. We are thankful for Patriarche Park in Metro Lansing
Great park with a big play structure for kids and a ton of open area. Also a great place for parties.
Great place to take the youngsters on the first really nice day since winter set-in.
Nice park! Many public restrooms,plenty of picnic areas, and dog friendly!
Very nice park.  Lots of space and activity area.  Playground, ball fields

name: St. Thomas Aquinas Church
address: 955 Alton Rd, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: A really heart felt homily by the priest. Even the parishoners were very kind as well. I feel like I can make this Catholic Church as my home church.

St. Thomas is a combined Parish with St. John Church and Student Center which is a 1 block walk from Michigan State University Campus with Worship Services many times throughout the week at both locations. Also available at both locations are many opportunities to gather with others at meals, retreats and studies that help your faith to grow. All of these, at either location are for people of all ages; College students, residents, children, and families. St. Thomas is located 1 mile from campus with an abundance of free parking and garden areas for your enjoyment.
One of the Most Beautiful Churches in the Midwest. I grew up in East Lansing & went to St.Thomas Aquinas School too!
Very welcoming and a traditional feel to the Catholic experience.
What a beautiful church and attended a very nice Service of Rememberence mass.

name: Harris Nature Center
address: 3998 Van Atta Rd, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews: Beautiful, clean, well-maintained nature area with nice selection of short to moderate-length trails.  Most are easy with few very moderate hills, one stairway to lower river walk.  facilities for family-oriented nature activities.  Free parking.
We love this place!!! It's a great place just to take a walk & they have really great recurring events there like moon light walks and stories by the fire. Our favorite local place. ♡
Very nice walk in the woods along the Red Cedar River.

One of the best nature centers in the area.. Very serene have loads of activities for all ages.. I went during the winter for howl at the moon walk with my puppy  which they have once a month or every fri not sure for $10.. N I also attended the winter festival thr end of january which was fun as well there were sleds hot chocolatr, bon fires on top of all that I still need to try their sledding classes and cross country ski classes nxt winter@!!!!  Overall a fun place for all ages,  & all seasons@@@@!!!
Great fun for kids of all ages... The hiking trails in the woods are very nice.

name: Lake Lansing Park South
address: 1621 Pike St, Haslett, MI 48840, USA
reviews: Nice public park and beach area. Concessions and paddle boat rentals are available in the summer months. There are three bars/ restaurants right across the street,  two have roof top patios that serve food and drinks. There is a fee for parking that is minimal.
Beautiful and clean park. Great place to listen to music in the park on Fridays during summer months.

This park used to be so fun, however, in recent years it has really been neglected. The beach area is still nice, and so is the grass area. The climber for the kids keeps them occupied for a bit, but the big wheeler track needs a ton of attention. The first time we found the track there were very few big wheelers to use, almost all were broken. I brought my son back with his own and he rode for a while, but quickly, other kids wanted turns. Although I believe in turns, it took long enough that it was time enough where we had to leave and had trouble getting the big wheeler back. The next two years we went back and it's worse and worse,  there is carnage of broken big wheelers and tricycles all over. I wish something could be done because this is the only track I know of in this community.
Summertime fun in the sun and Friday night concerts all season long.  Life guarded beach with the lake offering some good fishing.  Fun to be had by all.
Our favorite swimming place in the summer! With a big playground nearby, lots of space on the lawn and surveillance of the swimming areas.

name: Cristo Rey Church
address: 201 W Miller Rd, Lansing, MI 48911, USA
reviews: This is an amazing Parish!  Excellent liturgy, multicultural, and traditional.
This is our Place of fellowship/worship every Sunday at noon for their bilingual mass
Beautiful church with a bi-lingual priest. Service is nice and the congregation's friendly.
Clean. Nice facility. Friendly

Great food...Great Music..
Great Merchandise. Everything well priced. I was at the weekend festival on Saturday night. My attendance was unexpected but I plan to return for the 2020 Cristo Rey Fiesta.

name: Hawk Meadow Park
address: 6160 Delta River Dr, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Beautiful community park in convenient semi-rural location.  Well-maintained trails with maps, directional posts, and benches placed throughout.  Dogs are permitted and everyone obeys the rule that all dogs must be leashed. No crowds, but enough use to ensure that people feel safe.  Free parking. Convenient restroom building.
Peaceful place to walk. Most people clean up after their dogs. Just the right size with nice scenery. Great place to take the kids to.
Great walking trail with plenty of shade. Beautiful location and just the right length.
Lovely place to walk, and the lake is my favorite spot to stop for a break and enjoy nature.
A pretty little park with lots of well maintained trails for biking or hiking.

name: Washington Park
address: 2700 S Washington Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Washington Park is a pretty nice park has suitable parking" a Pavilion for shelter from the sun and rain. Children's play area which appears safe and more importantly a His and Hers public restroom that isn't padlock you can actually use it. Peaceful place.

I drove home a way I don't normally go and passed by Washington Park. It looked like it was big so I reminded myself to take my 2.5 year old on a nice day. When we finally got the chance to go I was not disappointed. There are four play structures, one for little infants, one for toddlers 2-5, and two for 2-5&5-12. And a giant fake rock to climb on! They have grills, a pavilion, and tons of bench seating. There is a huge grass lot with tons of open space I saw some people taking their dogs out to run around. Lots of parking. My only downside is trash laying around because it could use a couple more garbage cans. I can't believe how quiet this park is though, maybe it's because it's a little hidden, but I think it's really a gem.
Spacious and a lot to do with the kids if you bring activities
Pokemon go is awesome negative comments are going to happen.. but at least they have a game that get people walking and or outside.
My son loves it. Adults can have fun also!

name: Hartrick Park
address: 3685 Hulett Rd, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews: Fun little park. Has a nice wooded path with other paths to walk your dog. Has 2 baseball diamonds and a pavilion with Mple parking.
A nice park. It has a lot of parking spots and spacious play areas as well as a large play set and two baseball diamonds

The Pavilion, Bathrooms, Playground and Trails are all very nice, and well maintained.  The baseball diamonds however are covered in 2 grit sand paper, are not raked and level (large holes in front of pitchers mounds and at the bags) and are a hazard to everyone that uses them. Very disappointed in the quality of materials used here. I would avoid this place for your Baseball/Softball games & practices unless you like treating road-rash type injuries and washing rocks out of your skin and everywhere else.
Well-kept like ALL Meridian Two parks. Very visitor- & pet-friendly
Great place to play soccer, base ball, cricket and other outdoor sports and also have slide and stuff for kids and a nice walking trail

name: Nancy Moore Park
address: 1960 Gaylord C Smith Ct, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: Loved the park and the trails. Many facilities and playgrounds.

This is such a wonderful park. The addition of the fenced in small dog park is wonderful. There is a membership cost. The office is there on the left when you turn in. The volleyball, baseball and soccer fields are well maintained and usually always in use. The are also lots of paved and unpaved paths through some beautiful scenery.
Love the small dog park here! Super cute. I wish people would clean up after their dogs though; there was a lot of poo everywhere.

Lots of trails to walk...walk your dog or ride bikes. Beatiful place to go !!! Has baseball fields...playground...volleyball...picnic areas. They have small dogpark. Just not open yet. Hopefully soon !!!!
Great running trails

name: Fitzgerald Park
address: 100 Fitzgerald Park Dr, Grand Ledge, MI 48837, USA
reviews:
One of the most beautiful places in the area.  I've been going to "the Ledges" since 1968.  You could climb the ledges up until
 The early 1980's.  Due to erosion we had stop the climbing and just walk the trails.
Great place to go for some adventure and to play in nature. Great place to take photos and great things to fo here. Never a dull scenery or moment.

A beautiful park with easy access for residents of Grand Ledge, Lansing, and surrounding communities. There is a very small fee for those who live outside the county.  Park is clean, spacious, and well maintained, with activities for all ages.  Walking paths offer many scenic views.  The paths are wide, well maintained, well marked, and generally safe.  Park includes clean restroom building.  Plenty of parking.

Great place to roam around and have plenty of space to run. There is playground equipment for the kids as well as disc golf. They have a merry-go-round in the playground which can be tough to find now. Lots of swings, slides and places to climb. Separate structure for toddlers. Great place to gather with a group as well with pavilions and grills. Huge park - great place to spend a day!

My family has been here for work parties, groups of friends and just two of us. Something for everyone.
Beautiful place to walk or play disc golf. I prefer this park in the off season due to its popularity.

name: Lewis Landscape Arboretum
address: East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: A beautiful paradise amidst the city! We visited when the peonies were in full bloom (mid-June) and it was stunning. We were amazed at the number of peonies and there were bridal parties taking pictures everywhere. We also walked one of the trails and enjoyed the lush beauty. There are a few main trails, but also many smaller offshoot trails that were fun to explore. I would definitely visit here again if I am ever in Ann Arbor.
It's a beautiful place nice for relaxing and enjoying the nature. I love it

This place is fantastic! Awesome scenery and most things are labeled. Venue is open to the public and is great for family outings and picnics, too! Unfortunately, this is a pet free park (which totally makes sense), but it's definitely worth a visit, for sure!
I loved the scenery! Great job to the staff, students, and volunteers!
This has grown a lot, beautiful place for senior pictures!
Delightful.  Surprising number of flowers in bloom for early November.

name: Nokomis Cultural Heritage Center
address: 5153 Marsh Rd, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews: Very cool place lots of Indian culture there.

This is a wonderful place to visit, especially if you have little ones. They have elaborate exhibits that show the history of Native Americans. The staff is friendly and well informed. They have limited drop by hours, but during summer break this is a wonderful place to visit. Also, they have several events throughout the year that are worth keeping tabs on. Beautiful experience.
Great place, very knowledgeable staff and instructors
It's a good place to learn about Native American cultures.
Wonderful people!

name: Ferguson Park
address: 4540 Okemos Rd, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews: Good spot for kids to play and enjoy small river
Nice park! With a play area. Hidden behind some trees, right next to the road.
Georgia my little Maltipoo loves it.
Took my Dachshund here! It was awesome! 😆

Nice park for a quick walk and a few minutes for the kids to play. In the spring there's usually flooding but other times are ok. The river has some nice fishing spots from shore. Didn't see any hiking trails. With the Spring floods and available space being somewhat limited, I give this rating. But it is a nice place to visit to break up your day.

name: Michigan Orthopedic Center: Charles J. Taunt Jr, DO
address: 2815 S Pennsylvania Ave # 204, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: I was blown away by the level of care provided by Dr. Taunt and his office. I had a full knee replacement and he was wonderful. So far I’m 2 weeks post surgery and the level of care remains. Any and all questions have been answered promptly and the day of surgery, he personally came to check on me before and after multiple times. MULTIPLE TIMES! I’ve never had a doctor do that !!! I would highly recommend !!! I’ll be back for my other knee soon :)

I had a partial knee replacement elsewhere and had pain for years.  I went to see Dr. Taunt and he said it should be replaced “when I was ready”.  He wanted me to decide when it was time.  I was totally impressed and sold on him again as I had seen him before.  Finally I couldn’t stand it anymore and went back and was scheduled for surgery 11/5/19.  Because of his brilliantly made “Health Loop”’that sent you messages and reminded you each day what to do (start exercising before surgery, when to stop your supplements, etc.) I was lead each day with what to do before the surgery.  It was so informative and even had a one minute video of a knee replacement....very simply showing the knee bones and what would be done.  It took all my fears away and I looked forward to my next day’s Health Loop every day!  It was truly amazing and continued for almost a month after surgery asking great questions so he knew how your progress was going.  I would never go anywhere else when it’s time for my left knee.  He is an amazing doctor!! He would be my number one recommendation for a knee replacement!

Outstanding pre surgery infection prevention. Knee replacement is healing quickly and feels great. Doctor and his staff used a communication portal daily and any questions are responded to quickly. Came highly recommended by other medical professionals and did not disappoint.

I am a Surgical Nurse of 24 years, Dr Charles J. Taunt Jr, DO  is the surgeon I recommend.  He continues to  always look for  ways to improve his outcomes for his patients. He is the Best! He has given me a new beautiful  Right Total Knee replacement October 2019. My experience  has been amazing and I am very pleased with my out come. He also gave my husband Bilateral  Total Knee replacements in 2016 and 2017.  We are both very active and very grateful that we have such a talented Orthopedic Surgeon.

The expertise and compassionate care of Dr. Taunt and his team were exceptional.  It made all the difference in the world with my total hip replacement, something I was very nervous going into.  The GetWell Loop portal, so they can check in with you and you with them every day, is a bonus!

name: Michigan Women's Historical Center & Hall of Fame
address: 105 W Allegan St, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Great place, very interesting, and fun for kids

I found this very enlightening and interesting. I was surprised at the number of important women who accomplished so much but have gone mostly unrecognized. My only suggestion would be to add some audio recordings that people could listen to as they viewed each woman... because the audio experience is such a valuable learning tool.
I went here years ago and found it very interesting.
Women showcasing our history, supporting local agencies, causes, and community.

name: Sleepy Hollow State Park
address: 7835 E Price Rd, Laingsburg, MI 48848, USA
reviews: The trails are amazing, you can hike for miles and be surrounded by nature every step. It's a great place to camp, hike, bike and even ride horses. It's one of my favorite places to create memories.

This is a large state park that seems intended primarily for camping, boating, and horseback riding. There are several trails with sporadic trail markers provided. The sole reason for my visit was to explore trails on foot, hoping to admire wildflowers, observe (wild) animal habitats, and take some photos. The trail markers at this very rural park play a critical role in keeping horses off of pedestrian trails. There was ample evidence (💩) to suggest that the trail signs are not always successful in doing so. While this park has a lot to offer, I prefer other great parks in Michigan for their natural landscapes and scenic interest.

Great place to spend the day. The fishing was great, swimming was fun. They have geocaches in a few places of the park. There is frisbee golf course which was mostly shaded. The park is open until 10pm. The restrooms are clean and there was ample parking. They also have a dog beach.

A nice campground conveniently located off exit 105 on Interstate 69. Clean bath houses and generally nice campsites. Spaces 1-100 will be closed through July 31st due to an electrical upgrade.

The downside is the dump as there's only 2 positions to dump for 228 campsites. Be ready to wait!

It's a Friday afternoon and it's almost like I've got the lake to myself the water is beautiful sky is robust with big fluffy white clouds and I can't wait to get my pole in the water I'm going fishing

name: Lincoln Brick Park
address: 13991 Tallman Rd, Grand Ledge, MI 48837, USA
reviews: I love this place because you rarely see anyone else there. So don't visit, you'll just make me take a star away from this review!

Cant wait to go back and spend more time. Historic . This was a happenstance I was just looking for a place to walk my dogs while driving to the east part of state. A great stop  going back to explore.

Great park with great trails. 

-The Heron Hollow trail offers the best view of the beautiful green swimming pond and 300 million year old ledges. Great place for pictures. There are some steep hills though, so wear good shoes. The pond has a small beach area, but not much shoreline that is able to be utilized. 

-The Beachnut Trail offers historical explanations of the place with a few remnants of what used to be. Has a pretty tall bridge with a high view of the woods around you.   

-Deer Run trail is a favorite. Walking through the woods with the Grand River flowing right beside you. Great private place to take the dog for a dip. 

-Prairie Loop is the most mellow of the trails being made up of grass. 

-Tallman Trails seems to be the least traveled and is my favorite. Great views of the pond and Grand River. Plus a view of the dam. On this trial you can access trails not displayed on the map. If you dare to take them you’ll find some interesting rocks and a cute waterfall.
Great park. Lots to see here. Mostly good for walking trails, but you can see a river, lake, cliff, and grassy fields. Well worth visiting at least once.
Great spot, quiet, good for walking.  Wear boots in the wetter months.  Small playground for kids.

name: Lake Lansing Park North
address: 6260 E Lake Dr, Haslett, MI 48840, USA
reviews: Clean, well-maintained park with array of activities, sports fields, grills, picnic shelters, walking trails, boat launch, adequate parking, restrooms, and modest entry fee.

Very serendipitous experience after visiting family living near the lake, went for a walk and then this park came into view! We walked in during April (nothing growing just yet, lots of loud frogs), and initially we thought it was a nice small park with parking, grills, and gazebos... Only to find a few available trails to walk! It was a nice experience, well-maintained, and some unique sights/animals. May occasionally spot a white-tailed deer! 🦌 

Very secluded/foresty/nature trail when compared to the open lakeside area of the South Park. If you want a nice quiet nature walk, come here! Highly recommended.
Great place to get outdoors! Bring cash because you might have to pay an entrance fee. $3 for residents, $5 for non-residents as of 3/2/2020.

Beautiful place, love taking my dog here for walks. But, filled with invasive species (autumn olive, Japanese barberry to name a couple). Hoping parks will initiate a program to bring this plot of land back to its natural historic forest!

The best top secret in the Lansing Area...
What a gem...

name: Lansing Parks & Recreation
address: 200 N Foster Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: BEWARE! Teachers at "Homeschool Days at Foster" are malicious. Gossiping about your kids being your backs, including confidential information. Untrained staff provides subpar instruction to kids and usually have no clue how to manage kids, particularly quirky ones. Programming is what you would expect from a city that doesn't invest dollars into facilities nor communities. Teachers and staff do not communicate effectively to parents.
Great park but they won't let you bury your pets there so don't even try.
Belly dance classes with Garnett are amazing!  The opportunity to learn with a professional who has performed and taught all over the United States is priceless! Lots of fun too!
Clean building, friendly and helpful staff.
The TV show is pretty good

name: Trager Park
address: 1316 S Pennsylvania Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Nice little park next to the Red Cedar River along the Lansing River Trail.  No pavilion or playground, it is across Pennsylvania Avenue from Ingham County's Potter Park and Zoo.
Amazing spot for pictures, and relaxing times
Quiet and serene. Nice spot for a Geocache!
Great city resourse
We need mor parks

name: Bharatiya Temple
address: 955 Haslett Rd, Haslett, MI 48840, USA
reviews: VERY PEACEFUL VERY ACTIVE....PEACEFUL ENV'T BEAUTIFUL TEMPLE...HAVE  A LOT OF NICE EVENTS AND ACTIVITIES GOING ON ALL THE TIME..WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Well established temple.. all Pooja done by request. All festival time we can meet our Indian community people.
Not really qualified to judge this location as I'm a guest. Very welcoming even though as a Westerner. Fun Diwali festival!
Very peaceful vibrant and lots of nice activities n events!!!
Nice to see a Hindu temple in a place like East Lansing. Though not huge it still looks good.

name: Sam’s Physical Therapy, P.C
address: 1515 Lake Lansing Rd, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Sam is by far the best physical therapist I have ever worked with, and with three ruptured discs in my back, I have had a lot of therapy! Sam is extremely knowledgeable about his profession and takes pride in being able to help his patients get back mobility in whatever extremity needs work, and range of motion. He ensures you are completing the exercises correctly by modeling the exercises and then watching as you complete them to safeguard against injury. He explains how the exercise will benefit your body, and what areas it will strengthen. Lately, Sam has had some assistants working with him, and he is a wonderful mentor as well. He explains to them how he works with his patients, and has his assistants explain to him what they would do by engaging them in open ended questions. Lastly, Sam does this all with a sense of humor! When you have to have therapy, you might as well enjoy it, and I have had the opportunity to laugh a few times over his sense of humor!

My mother and I have been to several physical therapists for knee and shoulder issues. Sam by far is the most caring, thoughtful, and knowledgeable person who helps you with encouraging words and explanations how different exercises help your situation. He is kind,respectful, patient and listens to your concerns. Best in town.

Sam has a wonderful bedside manner. He challenged me to stretch myself to get the most out of my new knee. I so appreciated how Sam took time to explain the benefits of each therapeutic exercise to me and gave me practical activities that I do from home or work. 

I would highly recommend Sam to anyone seeking therapy!

Sam was VERY professional at his work for my injury towards my shoulder. He's very flexible, kind minded and the best physical therapy I've had from anyone. I'd definitely recommend to everyone who needs therapy. Blessings to you and your family, THANK YOU SAM!

I came to Sam with an injury from work. He was absolutely amazing. He worked with my needs! He didnt have his own agenda of how I should heal. He changed up his plans for the day, based on how I felt day to day. He still pushed me to work hard, and praised me when I met goals. I will be coming back to Sam if I ever need therapy again. 
And if you read this Sam, thank you and thank you to your staff.

name: African World Museum and Resource Center
address: 1136 Shepard St, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews:
Lansing based All Around The African World  Museum & Resource Center, is a Union of the diaspora . A place for the community to learn and explore.

Educational opportunities and tour by Dr. W Davis a MSU Grad and founding Father. Lots of knowledge and fun a must fir all.
Super cool African Festival Last Summer!
Awesome

name: Cooley Law School Stadium
address: 505 E Michigan Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Randomly drove by and saw the Holiday Lights decided to stop and I'm glad we did! My boys aged 9, 7, & 5 enjoyed the stadium all lit up and the train ride. There was much more to do but we just enjoyed the lights. Thank you to all that helped put this on. I used to drive around with my family looking at Christmas lights, but it's not the same for my boys it's always hard to find homes decorated. So, thank you Cooley Law Stadium! ☃️❄🎄

Always love seeing the lugnuts play here even if they dont win. Always have great field games for the fans to play. I got on the field and did the inflatable race and even made it fun for the other players by bringing them the barrel to give them a chance to win. Then did a front flip at the finish line.

Nice stadium, graphic signs are clear.  Food is outrageously expensive ($8.00 a square slice). Drinks were no better. Very friendly staff.  Box office lady was super nice and patient with us.  I had planned to bring everything I needed for the baby but couldn't bring anything...  No strollers in the stands ladies and gentlemen. Ticket taker was delightful and greeted everyone individually and still kept the line moving. Good experience hope to go again when the kids better understand it.
Great spot on a summer evening for Class A baseball Lugnuts. Inexpensive tickets, good cheap food & beer nights. Take the entire family!!!!!
Great games and good customer service didn't get an answer we ran out of anything.

name: Rotary Steam Clock
address: 100 N Grand Ave, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: This is a beautiful piece of Michigan History!  One of the many free places to visit in Michigan’s Capital!
So cool!
I didn't know it was there. I have probably walked by it 100 times in the last year.

name: Owosso Curwood Castle
address: 224 Curwood Castle Dr, Owosso, MI 48867, USA
reviews: Great place to learn about the wildlife author  Oliver Curwood. A very interesting building. You wouldn’t expect to see a “castle” in a small Midwest town. The local organization has done a great job keeping it up and informative. Worth the $5.

Great place to relax and take a leisurely strol. River, small falls, stone piller walking bridge all add to the things to see. Very old log homes and building are available to tour on some days. OH yes a Castle in the center of Michigan right along the river, Camelot maybe... You decide and make your own adventure stories.

So much history in one little place. If you get the chance to go here...do. make sure you play around with the acoustics at the top of the tower too. So neat and surreal. Loved the movie in the lower level, and the set up was very nice and easy to follow. Would definitely go again.
Very beautiful main room, not much else to the place. The staff woman was very friendly. The adjacent park is beautiful and very nice for taking a stroll.

This was a really cool place. I had never heard of Mr. Curwood or his story's previous to visiting his castle. Was looking for something to do around our area and decided to check this out, man was I happy. There is not a ton to see in the castle but what you do see is filled with information on this guy's life and the numerous books he wrote that influenced over 200 movies.  Make sure you walk around the grounds and take the short walk to see where he actually lived as well. The art museum nextdoor is also worth a visit.

name: Kids 'N' Stuff Children's Museum
address: 301 S Superior St, Albion, MI 49224, USA
reviews: Took my 4 year old there while I was in the area visiting family. Loved it! Very clean, lots of great options for creative and pretend play. Definitely bring spare clothes if your kid likes the water table. Their waterproof aprons do eventually absorb water.
It is definitely a great place to take younger children! Our five year old had a wonderful time!

You can play make believe with full size equipment. You can put on an impromptu concert with bang pipes and xylophones. You can play blocks, dinosaurs, and build a fort. I love this place (I'm an old man) and I love to take my kids and grand kids there. I hope they stay for decades more.

Wonderful exploratory play and learning museum for children. Great experience for kids and families. Wonderful staff who are very kind and helpful. A great variety of areas and experience. Definitely recommend anyone going to it for fun and I plan to return with my family.

Whenever we're heading anywhere in Michigan, my 4 year old has to come to Kids 'N' Stuff. Michigan is now officially the Kids 'N' Stuff State. 

There are so many options for any kid to enjoy themselves, if only for an hour while passing through. Adults can have fun, too!

If you're in the area I can't recommend this place enough, your kids/grandkids/nieces/nephews, etc. will love it.

name: Castaway Play Cafe
address: 1800 N Burkhart Rd, Howell, MI 48855, USA
reviews: I took my 1 year old son here a few times this past month. We've never been to a "play place" before so it was a completely new experience for us. We stay for about 2 hours and have lunch there. the food was good. it wasn't too busy for us so it was great for our first time. I love the fact that I could go in the play scape with him. Total I spend less than $20. my only grief would be that there is only a hand dryer in the family bathroom. I dont mind using it as it it's a good one, but my son didnt like it and freaked out and started crying. Otherwise the place is always clean and the staff is friendly.

I was so thrilled with this place. Great prices, clean facility, and most importantly, a friendly caring staff. I've been to other indoor play places closer to me where the staff spends more time gossiping than working. Not here! Staff is on it and gently enforces rules, which made me super happy. The games were affordable, between .25 and 2.00. The food was a little on the pricey side, but! They had good size portions and the food was super tasty. My five year old had a blast and is begging to go back. My one year old enjoyed having a toddler area where she couldn't get trampled by big kids. I guess maybe it'd be cool to have one other bounce castle for smaller kids, but I'm not complaining.

Absolutely the worst display of hospitality I've ever experienced. We called in the morning to get hours they were open. After being given information, we drove 30 min through the snow for my autistic sons birthday. When we got there and paid, we were kicked out after 20 minutes, so they could close and setup for a party...as if they needed to set up the 4 story play structure. Absolutely not happy paying $40/he to let my son have his birthday activity ruined.

Update...the manager apologized and offered free passes for a return.
Love taking my grandkiddos here. We spend lots of play time making memories and eating pizza!  Reasonable rates and clean atmosphere
Very clean, great prices, and plenty to keep 7, 5 and 3 year old busy.

name: Capital Bank Tower
address: 124 W Allegan St, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: This is such a amazing beautiful place, to the glass floor to looking up to the top of the capital is beyond words can describe. The executive offices are wow super nice. Must go to place for a tour if you havent already. But beware there is a glass floor in case of people affraid of them!
I worked here in the late 70s, used to party on the roof. The view was amazing!
One of the outstanding architecture in Downtown Lansing

name: Boulder Ridge Wild Animal Park
address: 8313 Pratt Lake Ave SE, Alto, MI 49302, USA
reviews: We came here for an all bldg outing and were not disappointed!   We went on the tour and the staff got a vehicle that could accommodate us all,  wheelchair spaces as well.   There was a long line but they did not rush or make us feel as though we were a burden.   It was great!   We ate lunch at the picnic area just outside the attraction,  and after walked through the park.   It was very cool!   We found another picnic area much larger and off the main path,  wishing we had eaten there...  We bought some lettuce and carrots for the camel's and giraffe's.  It was time for us to head back before we got all the way through,  but saw most of it. Maybe another time,  worth every penny.   I wish we could get a business membership!   If I were an animal,  I believe I would be very happy here💕

Seeing all of the animals was super awesome and you can tell they are well taken care of.  The staff is all friendly and my favorite part was how close you can get to the kangaroo. However, feeding a giraffe is a close second. It’s really a self led safari, which my boyfriend and I prefer. Don’t miss out on going on the free safari ride around the bigger sections of the park. The staff make it enjoyable and you see how huge the park actually is. Definitely would come back!

What an amazing place!  My son asked me to give a review because he wanted to support this park.  The staff are very friendly and informed.  One of the workers gave us great insight into the uniqueness of the animals.  One of kangaroos would let me pet it and then it tried to box me.  The staff informed that it is an aggressive female but is very friendly.  That was helpful to know. : )

Also, the Animal Encounter is worth it!  We were able to see up close three different animals and pet them.  There was a 1-year old in our group and it was so funny to see how the baby reacted to the fox, kangaroo and lizard.

While it is fairly obvious to me, they are just a beginning "zoo", others there seemed to be impressed. Most displays are pretty small and not well "decorated". You are able to get fairly close to most small animals so you are able to look closely at the animals. Will I take my soon to be born great grandchild there in a couple years? You bet. I will also try to take he/she to much larger zoos when he/she is older so animals can be seen in more natural settings. No I don't know the gender of my grandchild to be born in October, and my granddaughter is being very tight lipped about it. Works for me. I like surprises.

Love the zoo. You can tell the animals are happy and well taken care of. Even the ones you cannot touch are social, playing with the kids from the windows. The zoo smells clean, and not like animals and the store is fun and affordable for the most part. We will definitely be attending future events again.

name: Motz Park
address: 4630 N Dewitt Rd, St Johns, MI 48879, USA
reviews: I love taking my dogs to the animal friendly side! On the other side is a person only swimming pond with nice beach and grills in addition to picnic tables. No recreation pass required. But parking fills up quick when it's hot out. Good fishing on both sides. Trails around the ponds on both sides.
What a beautiful clean Park and prestine Waters very impressed
A great party. Nice and clean.
Nice location beautiful area
Great fishing caught 25. One day

name: Chateau Aeronautique Winery
address: 1849 Rives Eaton Rd, Jackson, MI 49201, USA
reviews: Really enjoyed the beer flight! Wines were good too. Nice location, friendly staff in the tasting area. We got an amazing tour from the owner and some great stories.
The tasting staff was very helpful and the wine and beer was very good.

So nice! Great staff and the owner gave a tour of his personal wine cellar and the airplane hanger! Everything was delicious and I felt comfortable asking questions. The staff was also very knowledgeable! A great stop for anyone who likes wine! They just opened a second location in Irish Hills that I can't wait to try!
Had no idea what this about as it wasn't on the radar. But now totally an advocate as blew me away. Highly recommend!
Decent beer and wine. Excellent atmosphere and service.

name: Woldumar Nature Center
address: 5739 Old Lansing Rd, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews: Such I nice place to go for nature walks, or even runs. I like to take pictures every now and then. I usually spot deer out wandering in the morning. It's pretty neat seeing the place change with the seasons. Lots to see!
Finally got a chance to visit this place. Very happy I did. Lovley forest and aesthetically pleasing views every which way you turn. Will definitely be returning.
My best friend got maried here yesterday. Wonderful helpful staff and gorgous.
Great trails winter or any season!!!!

Great walking trails.  My wife grew up in a house next to the nature center, so we went walking here often...and then had our wedding here.  We were the first wedding here back in 2006 and it sounds like they have then here all the time now :-)

name: ALT Printing Co.
address: 1139 S Washington Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Attended a great workshop. Owners taught the class and kept it light and fun! Would definitely attend another workshop and they have a lot of very unique prints.
I had a great time attending their "Ladies Night" screen printing class! The owners were very fun and knew a lot about the process. They even helped me remake something after I messed it up!
Great class.  A bunch of fun.  Will be returning for more with more friends!
Fun, fantastic place run by talented people!

I went here for the first time with my mom tonight for a workshop and had an amazing experience. We made beautiful Lansing-themed shirts and postcards. Tony & Kristen are super friendly and easygoing (and were super patient with me and my sloth-like pace of doing art). I encourage anyone to check out their shop and to attend a workshop.... You won't regret it!!

name: Ella Sharp Museum
address: 3225 Fourth St, Jackson, MI 49203, USA
reviews: A great place and full of history. Took my son here when he was little and had a great time
Beautiful grounds, plenty of trails and activities. Beautiful museum.
Great place for a wedding.  Good staff fantastic location.
This is a very nice small Museum. I really enjoyed the wildlife art area and clock display. The historic buildings are nice too, but tours of the insides are only given at a few specific times.

I had my wedding reception at the Granary. The staff were fantastic, the museum was open to my guests which they loved, and they made sure our space was very well taken care of. Chelsea Melin was absolutely amazing and accommodated everything I needed for the day. They were even able to bring in my husbands favorite beer which he thoroughly enjoyed. Hands down the absolute best place to host an event. Thank you for everything.

name: Waterloo State Recreation Area
address: 16345 McClure Rd, Chelsea, MI 48118, USA
reviews: Came here on a warmer February weekend. The road to the main area is all dirt. Wash your car after if it’s wet! Ha,ha. But the trails seemed properly marked and there were bathroom facilities open on the premises. I’ll be visiting again when it’s warmer and less icy.
Place is beautiful in the winter and spring. Not many people during this tyme. Easy to explore places and have solitude. I love this place.

A wild place to hike, there are several trails you can walk. You can walk along with the lake or in the woods. Remember to have a hiking shoes, trails are cover with leaves, you never know what’s under beneath
First blue sky in weeks. Needed to walk on some ice. What a beautiful part of the country. Very rolling and winding with mature woodlands. Therapy the natural way.
DTE is the best Moran's biking trails in lower Michigan.. So beautiful and lots of water to enjoy 😊

name: The Creole Burger Bar & Southern Kitchen
address: 1218 Turner Rd, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: We went here for Sunday brunch on a sunny day and decided to sit outside. For drinks we started with Mimosas and Cajun lemonade. The mimosas were the best I've ever had and was refreshing. For food, we ordered a Breakfast bowl and a Trust me quiche with a Side of potato casserole and cheddar grits. I specially liked the casserole and the bowl. The service was friendly but a tad bit slow. But we weren't complaining about that since we very looking for a lazy brunch anyways. Overall, I would definitely come back and try their Lunch menu and their glorious mimosas.

So good! If I had a car this would definitely be my go to bar and restaurant. Love they’re vintage eclectic vibe. If you’re feeling like trying something unique and tasty try their fries and dessert. Also their burgers are super good. If you just want a bar and hang out they have a separate section just for that, so they have the best of both worlds. This just made me hungry so I’m gonna stop writing this review.

We originally intended to go to the place next door but it was closed on Monday. Wound up here and I wasn't disappointed. What a cool little "hole in the wall" joint. Service was great, shrimp and grits were fantastic. I'd definitely recommend going.
Such a cool place with very nice workers. The Trust Us option was a hit with my husband. I got the mac n cheese with onions and sausage. We will definitely be coming back soon.

Highly recommend! Had Shrimp and Grits with Andouille Sausage and eggs.  So good.  They even make their own hot sauce.  Along with a steaming french press pot and fresh cream.  My server Shannon was great.  Friendly, patient and great recommendations Above and beyond!  Thank you

name: Deluca's Restaurant
address: 2006 W Willow St, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews: Deluca's is fabulous Italian food and the house wines are great. They are locally famous for their pizza but the pasta dishes are excellent as well. If you are lactose intolerant don't even pull in the parking lot, because they put LOTS of cheese on. Great people serving great food, that is Deluca's!!!

This place has time of choices in ours menu. I enjoyed it more than most Italian restaurants. It's really nicely decorated, feels like a very classy place. The pieces are very fair. The service was good and friendly. The bathrooms are kept nicely cleaned. I was very impressed with the ambiance, seems like a great place for a romantic date.

Hands down Deluca's is the best pizza in Lansing. The toppings are all the real deal, not out of a can. I've been eating their pizza for 32 years and the recipe hasn't changed for good reason. I can't speak so much for the other Italian entree's there, although, people I know enjoy everything on the menu. As long as I live in Lansing I'll continue to enjoy their great pizza!

Living in TX & craving Deluca's. Promised myself this treat once I came home for a visit. Ordered the vegetarian pizza. It was good but not the GREAT tasting pizza that I remember. And they didn't add the broccoli which I didn't realize until after I left. Wasn't that impressed with my desert of choice either (cannoli.) But server Mary 15 was absolutely AWESOME! Very sweet woman!

This is one the best pizza we have had. We did take out very friendly on the phone and in person. The pizza took about 40 minutes but for the heftyness it is understandable. We order a deep dish meat and a deep dish cheese.very filling hot, fresh and delicious . Would recommend.

name: Meat BBQ
address: 1224 Turner Rd, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: I got a pulled pork sandwich, my boyfriend got a burger, and we shared the disco fries with my brother and his girlfriend. I was surprised by the disco fries, they were amazing! The pulled pork sandwich I asked for with jalapenos, and it was amazing! My boyfriend's burger was really good as well. As for my brother and his girlfriend, they got mac and cheese with brisket on top. The whole experience was great, and the price was totally reasonable. I am totally coming here again soon!

We happened to be in the Lansing area today and I googled "good places to eat". 
This place popped up and instantly had my attention due to brisket.
I have honestly not had brisket this good since I lived in Texas.
I live about 1.5 hours away, but I will forsure be a regular at this place now.
AMAZING FOOD!! Customer service was great too. Very nice staff.

Best restaurant in the capital area. We go all the time. The sauces are some of the best I've ever had. The best part, their prices are almost unbelievable low for the amount and type of food you get. It's unreal. The only "down" side is the wait. Be prepared to wait when you eat there. The wait is almost always between 30-90 minutes. Also, if this is your first time going, when you enter and there's a huge mass of people, just push your way through to the little desk and get your name on the list. It's not really a line, so just get through and get on the list.

Incredible food. Absolutely amazing. Local meat, excellent flavors.

And yet the poor rating. Why?

Because they can't keep food in stock.

There's zero excuse to pop in on a Saturday at 7pm and they're out of food for the night. And this is constant. Often it doesn't matter how early you get there if it's a bit after they've opened. Out of food.

The only time you can go is the middle of the week at five or six. Any time after that and God forbid a weekend, you're screwed.

I understand it's difficult to keep the fresh meat, but maybe figure out how to before you open a new dining room you apparently can't serve.
Great service, great food. I cannot recommend the spicy creamed corn enough.

name: Good Truckin' Diner
address: 1107 S Washington Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews:
This is one of the best places in Lansing to eat! The food is always great, the rotating daily menu means there's always something new to try, and the variety is excellent. 

The only thing to be aware of is that it is small in there, so if you're trying to go on the weekend be prepared to wait, especially if you have more than one person and it's winter time. It's worth it though, and nowhere near the levels of trying to get into Golden Harvest.

Very cool little place with a great menu! I love their specials! You have to try any of their breakfast tacos. Soooo good! Just plan on having a wait for a table if you go during a peak time. Small place with limited seating but it's well worth it! Service is great too! Love this place!!

Tiny little diner with unique food options. You will definitely have to wait especially on a weekend morning. There is indoor and outdoor dining.  They have an extensive menu for breakfast and a large and cool street taco combinations.  When I went they had a gluten free daily special of a banana waffle with coconut cream. They were nice and customized it for me with toppings from another menu item. How could you not add bourbon banana fosters to it? 
Their servings are large and filling and they have some really fun sandwich options and I drooled over the loaded fries. 
Everything is made from scratch and cooked right in front of you. 
When I return to Michigan this is definitely going to be one of my first places to hit for a sandwich to go and hit the river trail. 
One of the tastiest places I've ever been and a hidden gem.

Adventuresome collage of characters creating a culinary cornucopia of comfort. I had the Big Country omelette which was lish shush, although I had to wait a sec for the cheddar to soften up a bit. The Kids are trying here. Can't deduct a half star, for i was lil' chill. Freddie Mercury and Queen were my musical companions, and i enjoyed this quirky cove.
I love this place. I have had almost every taco. My favorite is the jerk chicken. But, all are good.

name: The Cosmos
address: 1200 N Larch St, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: We are in town for a wedding and I am glad we found this place. I would recommend sitting on the patio. The buffalo cauliflower dip came with pita chips and was delicious. Both the Marge and the Black Truffle chicken pizzas were good.

Great selection of craft beers and wines.  Wood fired pizzas that are creative with unique ingredients. We tried the "Trust us" pizza (new each day) and weren't disappointed.  Lighthearted space themed decor.  The dining room isn't very large so get there early.

We come here every Thursday for the pizza and beer. We are always pleased! The trust us options are generally delicious and worth the surprise (also available in vegetarian and vegan)!  Sometimes there is a wait, and it is first come first serve - but it’s worth it!

The food here is great but I did not feel it was as great as everyone talked about. My roommate and I ordered the Trust Us and The Spaceball. I think my issues were that I am used to regular boring pizza and that’s what I was expecting. The service was fantastic, and everyone was super nice. The drinks were amazing but expensive. Apparently, Guy visited there, and Cosmos was on his show which is super cool for the greater Lansing area!
Had a wonderful time with Family. Pizza was wonderful. Friendly staff and a fun atmosphere.  A must visit!

name: Naing Myanmar Family Restaurant
address: 3308 S Cedar St #3, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Every dish was unique and delicious. And wonderful service with a smile.
Very delicious food. Very friendly and hard working family. The place looks a little run down on the outside but very nice and clean on the inside.

Firstly, this place is authentic and you can taste the fresh ingredients. You may wait a little but for your food, but freshly cooked food is top quality. 
The food is excellent, just the right amount of spice. You grab a menu and seat yourself and a server will come take your order. It's a welcoming environment. I would definitely recommend this place, you won't be disappointed!

If there’s anything Lansing has that Chicago doesn’t it’s AMAZING Burmese food! I’ve been wishing for great Burmese food in the Midwest for years, and this place is it. I had the Burmese fried rice and vermicelli Burmese soup, and both were outstanding. Hot, fresh, flavorful — all you can ask for from an authentic family-owned restaurant. Ssooo good. Definitely coming back on my next visit to Lansing.

The hospitality, the service, the cleanliness all top notch.  The food is good, very tasty, but the location leaves a lot to be desired.  You get a large amount food for the cost.  Certainly worth the price.

name: Capital Prime
address: 2324 Showtime Dr, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Went for Thanksgiving Day Buffet. Was sadly disappointed. Green Bean casserole- green beans were way way too crunchy! The Dressing/Stuffing - the carrots were crunchy!! Not even cooked.
