Foods were warm to cold and then when trying the Apple crisp for dessert, they couldn't even bother to cook that long enough for the apples to cook all the way through as they were crunchy too. Just a very crunchy meal today. Not what I expected when paying almost $150 for a descent Holiday meal out.  Very disappointed for such a high end restaurant.

Service was great but honestly....For the price, if you can handle a grill or a cast iron pan you're 100% better off making a steak at home or honestly just going somewhere more middle of the road cost wise. It didnt feel romantic or private. Just not what I expected for a steak over $100(there are cheaper options)

Recently ate dinner to celebrate our anniversary. They were very accommodating, including a table card, flowers and complementary champagne. The appetizer, entree and dessert were all very nicely prepared and tasted delicious. Our waiter Andy was the perfect combination of professional and personal. Upscale, yet casual environment. Nice selection of wine, alcohol and mixed drinks.

This is a high end restaurant, with clean and neat contemporary decor and white linen table cloths.  It’s got a sizable menu and a series of beef selections that will keep you full for a week.  I ordered a couple of Old Fashions before dinner that were mixed well and included the Luxardo cherries and large single ice cubes that demonstrate a more sophisticated bar.  The drink portions were a bit light.

There’s nothing better than having a hot bowl of French Onion Soup, but I’ve tasted better.  There was a strong sage flavor that needed to be dialed back.  The steaks tasted pretty good and were quality cuts of meat.

The main dining area was a bit chopped up because of the floor plan, but they have a neat bar area with dining seating as an option too.  If there was a down side, it was the price.  We had a party of four, soups and salads, but no appetizers, no desserts and only two alcoholic beverages between us and the bill was nearly $250.  

Capital Prime is a nice restaurant for a work function to entertain clients, but it’s not a place you’d go often on your own because of the price.

Excellent customer service, delicious food! If you’ve got $$ to spend & want a delicious meal, this is the place. The quality of the seafood is amazing 😋 I didn’t take any pics because I ate it too fast.

name: Mitchell's Fish Market
address: 2975 Preyde Blvd, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: The oysters are to die for. They are so yummy, 🤤 I ate like 3 dozen of them last night. The prices are a little high though, I bought the Americana dish and there was mostly potatoes on the dish, which I didnt appreciate, so that is why I took off 1 star. The sauce was good though. And my husband and son like their dish. The waiter Zach was great, very professional, he represents the company well. I encourage you to try it. You wont be disappointed!!

Our favorite for coworkers holiday luncheon every year, foods are always delicious and satisfied. Check in early that's I could hear coworkers and not much when busy. I have swordfish dish and it was very good. Usually I get fish & chips is my personal favorite dish.
Amazing scallops!  The waiter was knowledgeable and friendly.  The manager brought a couple of the different types of oysters for us to try.

Went here on an early Saturday evening.  There were seven of us. Waitress was very attentive and helpful with menu choices.  She asked everyone at the table their name and remember each and everyone as long as we were there. Everybody was happy with their main course selections.  I also ordered a shrimp and andoullie sausage shareable plate which was very ordinary and unremarkable. Overall though a great dining experience.

We ordered a large carry out order for our family and to deliver to another family. The pick up line was long and these people were clearly busting their tails to fulfill our orders safely. And it was delicious! Thank you!

name: Golden Harvest Restaurant
address: 1625 Turner Rd, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Wow this place did not match the hype. I’ve lived in the area for a few years and have heard good things from various groups about Golden Harvest. Which is surprising considering the expectation that the customer has to stand outside until they’re allowed to come in. To be fair, if you’re solo or in a group of 2 you probably won’t have the experience of a group of 3+. We waited outside for 50 minutes in 35 degree weather. After being sat for 20 minutes we mentioned to our server that we were ready to order to which he replied “oh well actually how this is works is you place your order when I’m ready to take your order” while he overfilled my coffee without an apology or cleaning it up. After our order was submitted we waited an hour and 45 minutes to receive our food. We watched 4 groups who sat after us eat and pay before we received our food. 10 minutes before our order was brought out we asked if it was almost ready since no employees had approached our table to acknowledge the wait, the same server replied “the food takes a minute, this isn’t McDonald’s... we tell people an hour outside and then an hour inside” once the food was brought to the table we were bombarded with questions of hospitality that most restaurants, even McDonald’s, would’ve given during our nearly 2 hr inside wait for food. I could see this place being enjoyable if you’re treated like a valued customer, but unfortunately it seems hit or miss. Having a short staff creates problems with fast turn around obviously, but to avoid a table because you don’t value their time is a choice of attitude. I’ve only given a few reviews in my life and it’s usually when the service is abnormal. Maybe others will have better luck or experiences. This was easily the worst and only “three hour” dining experience I’ve had in years.

You can have uniqueness without being literally dusty and dirty. I understand there is supposed to be a rustic old garage type feel, that’s cool, but still clean it. Also, not everyone wants to have to sit with a complete stranger at a very small table of four just because of your lack of seating. I bumped elbows with someone my entire meal. The food, itself, was good. Not bad, not great. The staff was in no way attentive, and only visited my table once within the hour wait I had after ordering. This is not including the hour wait outside just to get in, hoping to receive this “experience” that has been raved about, that I was still, at this point, excited about, until I walked in the door. All of the bad definitely outweighed the one “good” (the food. Not bad, not great). Based off your name and the good reviews that you do have, don’t get too humble to take criticism. No one is above their customers feedback. Treat your customers better, at the least.

Don't get me wrong, Golden Harvest is very good. I'm just not sure it's "wait in line for an hour after arriving an hour before opening on a weekday in the winter" good. I did really enjoy it the few times I've managed to go, but I'm just not dedicated enough for it with any regularity.

I don’t usually post reviews but this was the worst I’ve ever been treated by staff members at a restaurant anywhere.. not only did it take 2.5 hours for breakfast food (eggs) to arrive for our table of four, one staff member told us he would not apologize for the delay because “he doesn’t apologize to anyone for anything.” When we told the cashier we weren’t thrilled about the treatment and wait she told us “we should have played uno while we waited.” It’s really a shame because the food is good but it’s not worth being treated this way.

Food was great. Service is terrible all around, place is a lil run down, expensive for what they offer.
Most of the fans or employees even of this place are also toxic to any bit of critique someone has to say just because they don't agree with the hype or experience they do. 

Music is cool and the signs and other stuff around the place are unique.
This place could be a lot better then what it is by simple improvements.

name: Pablo's Old Town Mexican Restaurant
address: 311 E Grand River Ave, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Wonderful place. Food was delicious. Bathrooms are clean. If you're lucky Jackson and Lansing Railroad has been running near by on Friday for the first time in decades. I hope to see them some day. Seeing a train in old town has been a dream since I moved to Lansing 15 years ago. I plan to visit again to try out more of their menu.
Food is good. Although  I eat better before in a different place. But this one is still one of the good Mexican restaurant. Like it

I called to place an order, phone rang 20 times and I hung up. I drove there and walked in and the employee didn't care that no one picked up. I started to order food and the phone rang and she picked it up. That's annoying. Also was not allowed to use more than one $5 coupon from restaurant.com (supposed to be able to use $5 with each $10 spent) even though my bill was $43. Got home with the food and they had packed the soup sideways so a lot of it leaked. Food was fine, but the rest of this experience was poor

We went to this area of Lansing to eat at another restaurant. The wait was to long for us at that place, so we walked around a bit. We're from out of town, and not familiar with the local places. Luckily we walked by this Pablo's, and decided to try it. We were not disappointed. The food was simple, but the flavors were amazing! Perfectly seasoned asada, and the best refried beans I've ever had! The prices were surprisingly cheap for the quality of the food, and we were served super fast. Top notch authentic Mexican food.

Always really good! This place never disappoints!! One of the best places to eat in town!!!

In pic is beef caldo with the side of rice mixed in with it! My favorite to get with chips & salsa.

name: Bowdies Chophouse
address: 320 E Michigan Ave, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Love this place! The steaks are without equal. They've ruined so many other places where I used to eat steak because of how incredibly tasty they are. Service is impeccable. The staff here truly make you feel at home and everything is served fresh with a smile. It has a great laid back vibe to it.
Always fantastic food with great service. The folks here are very accommodating when possible and will be happy to make suggestions for menu items or alcohol. Never a bad meal here!

Everything was done exactly as it should have been. 

Our waiter was very friendly, our drinks were good, my steak was cooked perfectly, and everything was brought out at the right pace. 

The ambiance was lovely. 

Would definitely come again.
There is only one word that explains the true definition of an exquisite experience...... PERFECTION!

Amazing food.  Best steak ever!! Great table service !! . HOWEVER  ambiance could use some improvements! Edison bulbs mixed with blue light LEDs ,  Drop ceilings  bathrooms need details cleaned (edges and crevices ) the layout for bathrooms and traffic of people, waiter and waitress staff bringing food /walking flow is awfully cramped and awkward. Back steps are slippery.  Just some thoughts for a high end steakhouse.

name: Dagwood's Tavern & Grill
address: 2803 E Kalamazoo St, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: The beer selection was nice. My dag burger was very delicious. And the service was good. I'm glad that someone recommended the place to me while I was passing through Lansing.
Great prices!  Good service! Our three apps were tasty. Burger was also good but the buns were ice cold.

my brother and I make it a point to go here any time we're around and they NEVER disappoint. plus they make the BEST burger ever. they don't skimp on the onion, which to me makes them number one. onions rule.

Best place in town for a working class happy hour. It's okay if your work clothes are dirty. 
I love their olive burgers and their fries. You can always get a craft beer on draft too.
Great local bar. Good food, friendly staff. Owners Marjie and Mark have done a great job with this establishment! You need to see for yourself.

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 280 E Edgewood Blvd, Lansing, MI 48911, USA
reviews: Wanted to order something  I haven't  been able to get in the last  month. I ordered and pulled up and was really impressed.  I felt like I was pulling  up to a drive In restaurant.  They had the parking  lot all  set up and a  wait  staff  ready  to serve. Taking  orders or bringing  the  order out. Food was awesome  and so recommended  going to see them❤
Had lunch with my co workers.  My steak was delicious.  Thanks  Mark Jenks for the lunch you're the best supervisor any one could work for

This is not a high end steak restaurant but it does serve the finest steaks in the area. It’s a family friendly atmosphere with great food and drinks. Great for birthdays or just a regular weeknight out. I’ve been here more times than I can count and have not been disappointed yet.  I Usually get a steak but their burgers are amazing too.

My blue cheese salad w perfectly cooked steak on top was the bomb. Please, less salt in the mash potatoes, and those would get 5 stars, as well. Also appreciated honest description of green beans when my friend asked so she could choose a fresh veggie option she desired.  I wasn't informed first couple times I'd went there, and expected fresh green beans with bacon.

Food was good & service was great as usual. Ordered the salmon salad @ $13. Only gripe was that the cherry tomatoes were severely overripe & mushy. However, I do appreciate that they don't water down their dressings like a lot of restaurants. The mango margarita is soooo good, especially with the extra boost of either 1800 or Patron.

name: Zeus' Coney Island
address: 6525 S Pennsylvania Ave, Lansing, MI 48911, USA
reviews: We love coming here for breakfast/lunch!! And both times we've been here, the service from Ashley is great! She is so much fun and brings a smile to everyone. There is nothing greater than someone who thoroughly enjoys what they do. The food is great - I always get the Athena's choice breakfast with french toast (it is the best!!)

My first time in Lansing and I’ve been here two days in a row so far. I’ll probably be back again before I fly home. The service, food, and prices are great. The portions are big enough I can make two meals out of one. The restaurant has been busy both times I’ve been in yet it didn’t negatively impact the service at all. If you’re in Lansing and you’re hungry, you won’t go wrong choosing Zeus’ Coney Island.

Our Waitress Sydney was awesome that is why I gave them a 3. If it wasn't for her it would be much lower score. We had a table of eight people. The food was ok. The reason I wont be back is one of the other servers. 

The credit card machine wasn't working very fast so there was a line to check out. The hostess was doing a great job trying to move things along. Apparently we were in the way of one of the other waitresses. A tall older lady with her hair in a tight pony tail kept referring to us as,

Those F@%king people!

I think she realized she was not invisible when she saw me staring right at her. She only made the reference twice but she did it in front of friends 4 year old both times. Not cool

After reading google reviews I decided to give this place a try, and was not disappointed at all!
Even at 3pm they were still somewhat busy, usually a good sign. The entryway is crowded and basically nonexistent, walking in the door puts you basically at the counter where customers pay their bill and several were doing so at the time I arrived. Once seated our server, Ashley, was quick to greet us with a smile. I had the traditional gyro, made it a combo with fries and a soft drink. Asked to have my fries made with chili and cheese, was even given the option of shredded or cheese sauce. My company for lunch ordered a grilled chicken sandwich without mayo or a side. Total was a very moderate $16, outstanding value! Food came out in a timely manner and there is nothing I would change about it at all. They have a wide variety of menu items, breakfast all day and fair prices. The dining room was clean and well kept, I will most definitely return!

Great food , I had the hearty breakfast platter,  it was delicious,  the restaurant is very clean and the service was great, they kept my cup filled with bottomless coffee and the staff is very friendly and helpful, I enjoyed my eating experience at Zeus's coney Island,  looking forward to returning soon. 👍🙂

name: BRAVO
address: 2970 Centre Blvd, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: I used to work at Bravo in the Grand Rapids area and I extremely disappointed with how the owners treated our staff. I always thought highly of everyone and loved the food and experience I got and even gave to the customers. The store was open for 4 years and the owner showed that their values do not align with their actions, ESPECIALLY during a crisis. They didn’t even last a week. While I love the food and support all staff, I would suggest you think before supporting the Food First corporation.
They use Open Table for walk up seating. Seated quickly. Waitstaff courteous and friendly. Appetizers and food prepared and delivered timely. All tasted very good. Desserts were very good as well.

The food is delicious, the service is very good. The lobster bisque is good. The meatball appetizer was really good and a nice addition. Crispy was nice with a mild heat to the sauce. The grilled salmon cooked correct but left a little something to be desired. The Cesar salad is what it is. Not my favorite calamari. Creme brulee is solid and the cheesecake looks amazing. Deep-fried ravioli is awesome but my favorite was the meatballs.

First time at Bravo and I would definitely come back. Nice staff and great food! I got the Pasta Bravo. The complimentary bread was perfect as it had just come out the oven piping hot and the olive oil sauce it comes with was delicious!
Have enjoyed this location and Ann Arbor a few times. Varied menu of traditional Italian fare. Have yet to be disappointed. Good value for what you get. Service has always been top notch, too.

name: Grand Traverse Pie Company
address: 200 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: It doesn't get any better. A great place for a quick lunch,  or a gift apple pie to go, to give to a loved one. Lansing has great character as a city, and the Traverse Pie company adds to that overall great place to live or  visit feeling. I reccomend the pot pie.

Warm and comforting just like the food they serve. I had the Tex-Mex salad which was colorful and satisfying.  Some items can be pricey (a slice of pie is five bucks). I have only been in the afternoon. My guess is that the breakfast and lunch rushes are bonkers. Give it a shot. Peace.

I absolutely love coming to grand traverse pie company. I'm at the one on the corner of Allegan and Washington. There pie is simply marvelous in every way imaginable. I am writing this about the service which has truly impressed me. That's why this is one of my happy places I enjoy coming to when life has before times more difficult than usual just to be able to enjoy the wonderful atmosphere service, and food. I give grand traverse pie company 5 stars and 2 thumbs up in all categories.😁

Delicious and filling food. Crowded but also lots of space to sit. Food comes out relatively quickly, and I was able to have my lunch in less than 30 minutes. Pie is delicious, and their pot pies have a satisfying savoryness to it without being too buttery. Salad is just salad. I would recommend, especially at their prices.

I wish they would Have  lemon meringue pie all the time. You have to special order it. I tried the apple dumpling. Did not like that it was  cold. Needed to be warmed up more. They did do that without complaint. Nice service.

name: Fidler's on the Grand
address: 4805 N Grand River Ave, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Had only driven by this place before and today decided to give it a try, 100% worth it. The phone and pick up service was quick and very friendly! Prices are cheap for the quality and quantity of food. Not to mention the cinnamon rolls were some of the best my family has had!

First time at this popular brunch spot.  Seating method is a bit odd, this place is too small for the business it gets.  Great for the owners but the dining experience suffers.  The food prices were great, wait was extensive and was disappointed that my sandwich came out soggy on one side like it was waiting and fries were limp and not hot.  I don't mind the wait as long as the food is right.  Smoked brisket is not what I consider smoked, more like braised.  (Photo of fries and brisket) A little too much icing on cinnamon roll for my taste, ratio was off because they are quite thin.  The buttermilk biscuit looked great.  Would maybe go back to try.  Definitely not the worst but not the best place in Lansing for brunch. Games while you wait.  The service was great and owners appeared to be friendly and loved...had the food been great, it would have gotten 5 stars.

Excellent restaurant!  The staff is friendly and the food was even better.  I had the Gorgonzola Burger and it was delicious! Everything was fresh, like you can tell they use homemade patties and not factory/frozen.  
   The restaurant is small and doesn't appear to be much from the outside, but don't let that fool you!  It's well worth the visit.

Visited my folks in Lansing over Father's Day & we had to go to this new breakfast place. Woke up at 8 a.m. to get there early and for good reason! Arrived to a jam packed parking lot and line starting to creep out the first door! 

There's no sitting and trying to figure out what to eat. Hop in line, eye up the menu, order when it's your turn, grab you order number, your beverage *(Fresh Brewed Bigby Coffee)* and take your seat. 

Food followed shortly and was well worth the short wait! Reasonably priced and well portioned, we did the Santa Fe Breakfast Bowl w/chorizo, the American Breakfast Omelet (Mom loved the fried potatoes), and the Breakfast tacos (which is a breakfast first for me). Everything was well presented, super tasty, and filling. 

We also ordered 4 cinnamon rolls to go. I'll let you about those later, but we heard they're a must! 

Support local, support often. Enjoy!!!

This place is a true hidden gem. Our food was ready on time, phenomenal service, and incredible food. The menu is eclectic but classic. I would suggest this restaurant to anyone looking for a great, out of your ordinary, complete breakfast. I have not had the lunch items but I am extremely excited to try. 100% satisfied!!!!

name: Saddleback BBQ
address: 1147 S Washington Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: I've been to all the BBQ places in the Lansing area and Saddleback stands above them all. The service is impeccable, very friendly staff. The BBQ ribs and brisket are smoked just right along with the seasonings/rub. Took my daughter's there today and we had a fantastic time sitting outside in the sun. Also I should add, the bathroom is modern and super clean. Something I can be picky about when reviewing a restaurant. I recommend to all who are looking for good BBQ at a fair price.

I had the brisket, greens, and beans. My sister had the chicken tacos, and Mac the and cheese. Nothing was 'good'. The greens had extremely fatty  chunks of 'meat', the beans tasted like chili beans in disguise as baked beans. We could not eat them. The sauce containers were small and half of them weren't even filled up half way. The brisket was the best part hands down. We ordered online obviously, considering.

Love the bbq. Always fresh and quick service. Highly recommend the corn cake and pickles too! 
I like this place more than the other popular local place.
Loving that Saddleback is still open for takeout during this quarantine. We have ordered a few times and have been extremely happy with every meal! Brisket tacos are fire!

If I could offer 10 stars, I would.  This amazing place donated a mountain of amazing barbecue to frontline caregivers at sparrow hospital. 
 Thank you so much, the food was incredible!!

name: P.F. Chang's
address: 2425 Lake Lansing Rd, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Have not been here for quite a long time. New menu changes are very nice. Excellent appetizers. Recommend lettuce wraps. Entrees nicely done and very tasty. Reasonably priced considering the quality of food. Greeter and waiter were very cheerful and attentive. Dining area clean and warmly inviting.

We had a mini reunion here with my high school friends. The staff is commendable, it was so nice of them to help me get the reservation despite some challenges. And their food was equally delicious of course. Their lettuce wraps is a must try! I will definitely keep coming back.

Loved the sweet and sour chicken. A good balance of sweet and sour. Ginger was also a nice flavor in the dish. Our server was great. He made sure our drinks were kept filled and any thing we needed was taken care of.
Party of five. Seated quickly. Very nice atmosphere. Great service. Food was good, but very expensive.

I don’t intend to speak in hyperbole here, but the food honestly tasted like a less flavorful Panda Express for 3x the cost. Panda Express is legitimately serving better food than this PF Chang’s location. Also, even though we went on a really busy day, the service was surprisingly bad. Our server seemed like a nice kid but was way in over his head...and reeked of body odor. We were not happy, especially after coming to a PF Chang’s for the first time in many years and having nothing but fond memories in the past. 

The dessert with the coconut ice cream and fried wontons though, was divine. It is still one of my favorite desserts of all time. This is the only reason this review is getting 2 stars. That and the undeniably beautiful interior and lively ambiance. However, when the food sucks, nothing else really matters.

name: State Room Restaurant
address: 219 S Harrison Rd, East Lansing, MI 48824, USA
reviews: Beautiful decoration and atmosphere. The food was great. The service was amazing. Food was neatly presenting! They should have something specials for the graduates!

My date and I experienced the State Rooms sunday brunch buffet this weekend, it was fantastic, the salmon with chardonnay sauce was my favourite. Our waiter was excellent along with our host. I would recommend making a reservation and to note that one can reserve a more private dinning room similar to a conference room. They served Paramount brand coffee, we purchased a pound of from the restaurant before we left. I recommend the State room for a more upscale brunch option.

First time going, it's difficult to find the restaurant from the parking garage. Have to actively look around to find your way there. 

It was a pleasant experience being served by students learning. You could tell they were still learning, but they cared about their work. It seemed a bit empty for a weekend night in there, but still comfortable. 

 I wouldn't recommend ordering the hen though, there no thrills to it and chicken is better. But I would prefer juicy Quail on the menu instead. The desert menu is a step up from most restaurants and the sorbet is chilled and served perfectly. Very impressed with the sorbet. Would go back again!

My wife and I's first time coming here was after we had gotten married. We usually come here on special occasions and are never not satisfied with our food and customer service.  

Truly a great place to come. The atmosphere is soft, mellow, quiet, relaxed and all other synonyms of those words. I highly suggest The State Room Restaurant.

Prefer the small menu, fresh, simple, Michigan creative. Locals enjoy, summer offers outside jazz nite dining. Don't miss it. Teaching undergrads how to be successful in Hospitality Business. They learn first hand from professional chefs. Menu is locally grown food and produce.  Brunch is good if you haven't experienced it.

name: EnVie
address: 210 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Only been there once, a bit too soon to give it  5 stars, as I had a salad. It was good. The service was excellent, everyone else liked their meal. Will definitely try again. The prices were about what I expected. The menu ran from dinner salads, to burgers, to steaks. I would recommend.
Great place, extremely clean. The bar is awesome, they even have homemade bitters. Got to come back here!
Loved new york steak here!!! Very elegant ambience and perfect place for my v-day

Great ambiance. Delicious food and amazing service.
The bathroom is very clean.
I suggest reservation.
The service is fast and the price $$$
Great food. The atmosphere was very high end. Enjoyed our meals there. The duck was so well done.

name: Aladdin's Restaurant
address: 300 N Clippert St, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Pretty good Mediterranean food for the price. The humus is excellent and they give you plenty along with much fresh pita bread. Some places skimp on the pita Aladdin's does not. The real deal Mediterranean coffee is one of my personal favorites in the Lansing area. I appreciate the refills are free. Staff is friendly along with good service. I'm leaving 4 stars as opposed to 5 due to the uncomfortable both seats and the place has deferred maintenance/updates on the decor.

For $16+, you can get this lamb+chicken kabob w rice. To be honest, the price is a bit high for this portion. And the kabobs are a bit burnt. 

I am giving 4 stars to give them a chance to improve. I think they give a lot of condiments (bread, etc) but small meat and rice portions for the money. 

If you come here, i suggest the sandwiches as those are much more worth it.

My wife and I LOVE the Mediterranean menu at Alladin. ALL of our favorites are served in authentic fashion.  The Kebabs are a favorite because of the char broil and perfect spicing. And of course the delicious pastries like Bird Basket and a great way to top off a perfect meal.
I love this place and I’ve never had a bad experience! When I lived in Lansing, I went very frequently and I still visit quite a bit when I’m in town. Great food and nice people!
The food here was really good. My husband and I enjoyed our lunch here. Service was quick and friendly. Dinning area was clean. We will definitely eat here again.

name: Tannin
address: 1620 E Michigan Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Me and my wife had a good experience here. a very well thought out beer list, and I appreciate that. I had the chicken parmesan, the chicken was good breaded well and good flavor. The noodles were good. My wife loved her dish. The bread that came out to start was great. Bathrooms could use some updating, overall atmosphere was very nice. To end I had the bourbon ice cream, heavy bourbon flavor but still good. I would recommend trying it out of you've been curious and I wouldn't mind coming back.

Absolutely love this place. Service and food are both always great! 
Reservations are a good idea on busier nights as they may not even have room at the bar without a reservation.
At dinner be sure to get the bread with salted butter, it's amazing!
Portions are pretty large, but they offer a half for most of their entrees. Unless you are incredibly hungry, or want leftovers, the half portion is usually plenty if you have bread and an appetizer.

Oh man. What an experience. Cracked it off with the calamari ~ amazing. The attention to flavor and bringing together senses that BELONG, the sour of the pepper pickles balancing the weight of the fried calamari, dressed in lovely herbs. Divine. The goat cheese ravioli was a whole different beast. I can't describe that sauce but it complements the cheese in... The most perfect way. To top it off, a lovely garnish of basil sprouts, too cute. Absolutely an experience, and at a reasonable price! Make the trip

The food selections seem to have something for everyone's palette. The prices are fair and the food is excellent along with pleasing to the eyes presentation. We really liked how the entrees give you the option of a small or larger portion and priced according. My wife and I like to order different entrees and appetizers and share our food. We had Kyle as our server and he was spot on! A refreshing change from our last couple restaurant experiences where the food was good, however, the service was poor which is a real drag when you're spending decent money for the dinning experience.. The decor is just so so.. The building is the old Kentucky Fried Chicken that closed after an employee was murdered during an armed robbery in 2011. I felt there was a bit too many tables so when busy during Friday and Saturday night you're kinda shoehorned in there. The legs of the small tables near the bar are not level prompting our server having to place folded up napkins under one of the legs to prevent the table from rocking side to side. I would think a restaurant would have that figured out before opening up for business. A bit too much lighting in the restaurant I thought as well. All in all we did enjoy our experience and will return. When we do we'll request Kyle to be our server he was fantastic!

Excellent food.  Best pasta in the Lansing area.  Excellent wine selection. Great service.  Prices are more adorable than the old location.  I really appreciate that they offer large and small sizes on most entrees.

name: Taste of Thai
address: 2838 E Grand River Ave #2, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: The food here is very good. Host is welcoming and friendly. Ambience is very nice. Definitely going to visit again. Everything we ordered from the menu was delicious.

I like this place a lot and went there twice while visiting my dad over the holidays. I think he eats here at least once a week! If you come for lunch, the meal includes a tofu soup, salad, and spring roll. The entree portions whether for lunch or dinner are huge! The first time we came, we ordered lettuce wraps, papaya salad, and fresh rolls to share. I got a small cup of tofu soup and my dad had either tom kha or tom yum (don't remember). The next we came for lunch and I had the red curry noodle and my dad ordered the green curry. Everything was so delicious and the ingredients tasted very fresh. The service left a little to be desired but that's often the case in a college town. Overall, they have excellent food especially for having such a large menu. Definitely will be back next time I'm in town!

Went with some co-workers for lunch.  I ate the chicken pad Thai, which was tasty.  Maybe not the best, but good and a great value with the soup and spring roll included with the meal. 
Co-worker loved the pad Thai.
Staff was attentive and friendly.  The restaurant was clean and pretty nice ambiance.
I would go again and try another dish.

These might very well be the best crab Rangoon‘s I’ve ever had. LOL! I am surprised I loved crab Rangoon’s so much!  But these were perfectly cooked and surprisingly delicious! Th shell  is light and crispy and the sauce is a wonderful modern twist to the original and really sets it apart! The rest of the food was also wonderful, but I just love these!

This is one of the best Thai restaurants in Lansing/East-Lansing area. The food is great. The ambience of the resultant is not second to the taste of the food, either. If you go for the Lunch time you get a complimentary appetizer dish with your main meal. I recommend the Prik Pao fried rice and Pad See Ew (noodles).

name: Soup Spoon Café
address: 1419 E Michigan Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: My wife has talked about this place for years (she went once as an undergraduate). Every time I ask where she wants to eat, she always brings up this place. I have always denied her and we would go someplace else. Anyway, I finally caved in yesterday (because no one else was open) and we stopped here and ordered the lentil sandwich! WOW! That was by far the most amazing thing I have ever eaten! It tasted just like a hamburger, with the texture and meaty taste. I am actually really excited to go back again this week! They have lots to choose from and from the brief interaction I had with employees, they seemed very nice! I am so sorry I denied my wife in coming here, we will be back a lot more now! I wonder if they sell growlers or where I can get one? I really want to try there beers! Anyway, if your looking for great food, I highly recommend this place! Also, Thank you for being open during COV19!
The food here was fantastic and they do accept reservations, so that made things very easy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Definitely want to go back!

A small, quaint, pricey place! Appetizers and dinner meals were delicious. All dishes we re a tad bit salty and greasy, but interesting dishes. We were a large group and ordered several dishes and everyone liked theirs. Service was good, and the place was clean. Sides were small for meals for the price.

Nice open dining areas. Waitstaff very nice and attentive. Manager even stopped by to chat for a bit. Nice selection of craft beers. Excellent appetizers and entrees. The bread pudding was the best that I have ever tasted. Overall a very nice experience.

One of our favorite breakfast and brunch spots in the Capital region. The cocktails are always tasty as is the food. We have consumed many mimosas here with friends!  It's nice to see vegan options on the menu for vegetable inclined friends. The Smoky Scramble (smoked salmon and bacon!) is a personal favorite.

name: Altu's Ethiopian Cuisine
address: 1312 E Michigan Ave, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: Wow, this is super good food. I recommend going during lunch time for the lunch special because it’s the difference between spending 9 dollars on a meal versus spending 15 dollars on it. That beef stew is like oh yeah just right to me. Delicious as hell.

I personally love Altu's. I used to get my lunch to go from here all the time when I worked on campus. I was in the area and some friends and I decided to come here for dinner. The food is flavorful. And I really appreciate the presentation they provide. It's a nice environment inside and the wait staff are always very polite. I ALWAYS get the spicy chicken breast stew, but this time I also got a half order of the spicy lentils, and they were great. I loved my whole meal!

My first experience of Ethiopian cuisine was here, and it was a show-stopper!  I shared the vegetarian feast for 3 with friends, and it was a universal hit!  The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, anticipated our needs, and brought us more bread when we needed it to finish our feast!  The restaurant has a unique and casual feel and smells heavenly.  If you don't want to eat traditionally with your hands, utensils can be requested easily and the staff is very accommodating.   I will definitely be returning to try some more of the menu!

Have never tried Ethiopian food, but there's a first for everything! Well worth it if you're an adventurous eater, and even if you aren't. I always love a restaurant with a bigger vegetarian menu than not, and this place didn't disappoint. I highly recommend doing half rice and half bread, because the rice is delicious and gives you a bit more variety. We will be back!

So I've been here for around 4-5 times and all of the times their service and quality has been consistent and awesome. If you like really spicy food, then this is the place for you. Their food is really delicious. I've tried almost all of their dishes and each one is full of flavours. One suggestion though : it'd be nice to have some kind of sauce/dressing with the sambusa..

name: Charlie Kang's Restaurant
address: 109 E Grand River Ave, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews:
I have been a customer of Charlie Kang’s for over 12 years now and have always been a fan of their delicious food and great prices.

A few days ago, I placed an order for pickup. I have been trying to support local businesses as much as I can during this difficult time. Earlier in the day I saw an article posted online featuring Charlie Kang’s and it inspired me to place an order there. I was incredibly excited to eat some delicious Chinese and Korean food.

Unfortunately, I feel as though I set my hopes too high because I was really let down. I was very disappointed in the food :( (which was approximately $42 worth). The food quality was not at all what I remember it being; the chicken tasted like it was reheated/old and the chow mei fun did not taste fresh. I actually ended up throwing it away because it was that underwhelming.

I hate writing this because I have always loved Charlie Kang’s; I also hate saying anything negative because I know restaurants are struggling at this time. But, this is just my honest review.

I’m weary on trying them again because of this experience, but as I said, I’m a long-standing customer, so maybe it was just an off day for them.

The food here is delicious and it came to the table fast. The service was fast too. I really enjoyed the food. I was skeptical of ordering spicy food but in the end I'm glad I ordered it. The best Mongolian chicken. The fresh spring rolls was something I've never had in my life. After eating those, I don't think I am going back to the fried spring rolls. Amazing dish.
Great staff great price delicious food in good proportions!
Everything they do is delicious, noodles, stir fries and soups. I've tried like five different dishes and always leave happy. The staff is awesome.
Wonderful experience every time we dine-in or take-out. The owner is extremely nice and generous! Not to mention the food is fantastic! Best restaurant in East Lansing!

name: Huapei Restaurant
address: 401 E Mt Hope Ave, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: Very authentic Chinese food. They are open now after 2 months closing. Good food and reasonable price. My best is sweet and sour pork. 한국어 메뉴판도 있어요.

The best East Asian fusion restaurant in town! The food is unbelievably amazing. We ordered several different Korean, Chinese, and Taiwanese dishes, and they all came in generous portions and all immediately satisfied our picky taste buds. Enjoying the very authentic taste, we felt as if we were magically transported back to Asia.

Dear Lansing,
We have all been sleeping on Huapei Restaurant. This place looks ghetto as hell, sitting there on Mount Hope, but man is it FIRE. Great food and great customer service. This restaurant is also on Door Dash.

Best kept secret! I had given up hope on finding good Chinese fare in the Lansing area, and was very impressed with Huapei. The service and food are just wonderful! We got our tea and rangoons pretty quickly, and the total wait for dinner was about 20-30 minutes. Not too long, and it's obvious that everything was freshly prepared. The sauces appear to be from scratch, and the chicken and shrimp had a light, crispy battered coating. The rice was perfect. The freshly sliced green onions on top of the dish were a nice touch. The portions are generous and prices pretty low, with most dinners at about $9 (and I took home left overs!). Our server was so sweet and attentive, and was able to recommend a dish to me when I asked questions. We can't wait to go back!!
We are so grateful they are back open after having to take a break to care for a loved one.

name: Capital City BBQ
address: 1026 W Saginaw St, Lansing, MI 48915, USA
reviews: My son and I really enjoyed this restaurant. The pho was superb and my son's Cuban sandwich was yummy. The French fries were off the charts, fresh cut, and the array of various BBQ sauce made ketchup step aside. I can't wait to try the BBQ too. The service was perfect and the owner was there and delightful.

Great food for a great price! We loved the Brisket Banh Mi and it was amazing! That was by far our favorite items we ordered. We ordered take out and it was ready quickly! We got some much food for a reasonable price  and it fed three people easily! We look forward to going back!

Of the BBQ spots I've been in Lansing, Capital City BBQ has the best southern style sauce (The Dirty South).  I'll have to go again to get a good feel for this place.  My first try was decent.  The potato salad way too soupy though.

This is a great combination of foods-BBQ and Vietnamese.  I had a rice bowl with brisket, fantastic.  I checked out the bathroom.  Very very clean.  I think that is a testimony of a clean kitchen and backroom.  We will come again.

Incredible BBQ! Definitely one of my new favorite spots in the lansing area. Surprising variety in menu, with all the classic BBQ dishes plus specialty items like rib tips, smoked wings, even smoked salmon, plus an entire Vietnamese menu as well! And their Vietnamese stuff is no joke, it's delicious and made with obvious care. Egg and spring rolls in particular were delicious.

Highly recommend any sandwich, highly recommend the baked beans, highly recommend the sauces, highly recommend the fries. You're going to want to come back to try other menu items

It's definitely not a looker from the outside, and parking isn't super easy, but don't let that stop you!

name: Acapulco Mexican Grill
address: 300 N Clippert St suite.17, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Great food but not always the fastest service.

First visit of this unique Mexican restaurant and try their interesting dish Shark Tacos. It was delicious shark tacos, tastes like having fish tacos and I liked it. Playing Mexican music and kinda little loud for my opinion. They're fast serve food after placed order. I'm satisfied.

Nice and clean dining area. Seated promptly. Waitress very cheerful and attentive. Large menu selection. Many drink options as well. All food was prepared well and delivered quickly. Food tasted fresh. Reasonably priced.

I enjoyed my eating experience at Acapulco Mexican restaurant, I had the Enchilada Suizas it was very delicious, but somewhat salty for my taste, the restaurant is very busy in the evening hours, the service was great and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was very clean and the crowd is young and trendy,  and diverse,  looking forward to returning soon. 👍

Very good Mexican food. Dinner took a bit long considering the restaurant wasn't packed. Overall a good experience & we'll be back. Returned with my daughter a couple months later and the service was painfully slow.. Again it wasn't that busy. I revised my review to 3 stars.

name: Olympic Broil
address: 1320 N Grand River Ave, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Great local fast food joint. I always get a Humdinger Combo with a chocolate shake. It's a burger with a nice charbroiled flavor and loaded with everything I think a burger should have. The chicken tenders are also great and uniquely breaded or battered. I've never had tenders like theirs anywhere else.

The best "fast food", if you can call it that, in town. Food is always delicious. Everything is made fresh when you order it and you can taste it. Their chicken strips are the best in town with no competition. You can sit inside or sit outside with a nice view of the river. I've even sat down and hung out with some ducks while eating my lunch. It's cool, I'm happy to share with them. I'll never stop coming here. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.
Delicious!  Best fried mushrooms and one of my favorite olive burgers.  Plenty of booth seating inside.

Tuesday + warmer weather = Olympic Broil!  Usually.  However these are not normal times.  Go to Olympic Broil and help out Mike and Maria.  They've done SO MUCH for us geezers with classic cars over the years.  Time to return the favor.  Use their drive thru and don't forget to tip!!
The best most fresh fried fish sandwich.  I'm going back today to get another one. I just can't resist

name: The People's Kitchen
address: 2722 E Michigan Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: I eat here all the time and it’s great! Love all the plant based options because they really compete with the meat/dairy dishes on their own. The lemon pancakes for breakfast/brunch are to die for but the grits, and vegan chicken and waffles are also amazing. Dinner is great too though there are only a few options. Don’t worry, they’re all great, and there serve lots of small plates too. Really love this place! Also there’s generally a baked good in the morning and those are always good too.

Very cool vibe, love the decorations. Drinks were great... Don't want to undervalue a good drink. Bloody Mary & mimosa were definitely quality. Even with that being said the food was  for sure the star of the show! Brunch people get in here if you haven't. Grilled cheese & tomato Bennie was amazing, so we're pancakes. No doubt this is a repeat, regularly!

This place is a great find! I went here the other day with some family and was very impressed. I ordered the vegan chicken and waffles served with a  rhubarb compound butter and a slice of watermelon. 
The waffle had a nice caramel flavor to it and was very light. And the vegan chicken kind of had a  falafel flavor to it, is the best way I can explain it.
Anyways I haven’t really had much vegan food before and never at a restaurant and now I’ve become intrigued to try more things like this in the future. The only thing that would have made the dish more complete I think would for it to have some sort of a small apple slaw or salad on the side. That’s the only reason I’m not giving this place a 5 star review.
I also had a bite of a beet sandwich and that was perfect. The vinaigrette that is used with it and how everything meshes with it was like a dance of love. Honestly the sandwich I would rate 5 stars but anyhow nevertheless this place is a must try.

Hands down the food of The People's Kitchen is delicious. Everything that we ordered was super tasty and exceeded expectations. The pancakes were buttery soft and melted in every bite. The streak was freaking amazing and so was rest of the food. But you should note that the service is quite slow, but is friendly. We visited at noon on a hot day so even the space wasn't too comfortable for waiting for the food.

INCREDIBLE brunch menu. Ordered four dishes and every single one blew us away. The restaurant was born from a food truck operation, and it shows because all the seasonal dishes have a satisfying and fresh spin on them, like the pork belly cheddar grits, or the to-die-for crunchy waffle. Service was phenomenal and the space is colorful with plenty of parking. As of time of writing, the place is pretty new, so check it out before it catches on and gets busy!

name: Jalapeños Mexican Restaurant
address: 307 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: I order no cheese on my burritos. They always put cheese on it. I’m lactose so I puke every time.  It’s like they don’t know how to fold a burrito without loading it up with cheese to make it sticky. They’re disorganized and the toppings are flung everywhere and cross contamination.  I can’t tell you how many times I ask for something not to be added and turns out it’s in my food.  I find floaties in my fountains. I’m pretty tired of this place. They need to be more organized, clean, and on top of things. I wouldn’t recommend this place if you want food made the way you ask for it and not to have cross contamination from other products they serve with their food.

Nice and clean restaurant fast and friendly service, had the breakfast burrito , they are so good ! Parking downtown to the restaurant can be a hassle, so carry a couple of dollars in quarters to feed the parking meter, which is strictly enforced,  the  breakfast burrito are only available from 8-10:30 a.m. I certainly enjoy my eating experience at Jalapenos. 🙂👍🍽Just wish  the restaurant was not located downtown, because of the difficulty in navigating to it, as well as high parking rates and limited parking spaces.
Best restaurant in downtown Lansing. The best deals/specials ever (Monday and Friday get 2 tacos, rice, beans and chips for $7). Delicious, great service, they even have ice cream in the summer!

First time trying out the place, and I was impressed!  Had a shredded beef taco on flour tortilla with chips and salsa. It cost about $5. The flavor was amazing and I was full. I will be returning for lunch again in the future.
Great food nice atmosphere

name: Red Haven Farm to Table Restaurant
address: 4480 Hagadorn Rd #103, Okemos, MI 48864, USA
reviews:
Great evening at a local farm to table restaurant.  We ordered several dishes and shared. All very good. We ended the night with an adult Chocolate Milk.  Great finish.  I hope my son decides to go to Michigan State so we can go back!

The menu was easy to understand with several amazing choices.  

I like the farm to table concept.  Each dish was original and fresh.  

I though my ginger soup was the best I have ever had.  I got a bowl because I thought it would be good but they offer small shooter versions of you just want to try.

This place's atmosphere was very airy and relaxing. The food was great, although the grind was too salty for my taste. The bisque was amazing. The shrimps (saute) were exceptional, and I'm picky with my seafood. We had an apple up-side-down cake for dessert and it was delicious, especially the icecream! The highlight, though, has got to be the homemade sugar that came with my coffee. 
I could feel the care and the hospitality from the chefs and servers, and that showed through the ingredients, the food, and the service. My husband and I definitely come back to support this business and try other dishes.

I have eaten here for lunch, happy hour, and tasting dinners for special occasions. The rotating menu is seasonal and uses available produce from Michigan, and the dishes are well thought out. Lunch and happy hour are great for the price if you are concerned that Red Haven is not affordable. The dinner plates are surprisingly filling, so you definitely get your money's worth there too. Desserts are hit and miss, sometimes overly sweet and not complementary to the rest of the meal (but I recommend the pavlova when available). Cocktails have been hit and miss too; I wish they were on par with places like American Fifth. It can be loud and busy, so make a reservation and ask for the best times to be seated. Service is friendly and fast. One of the nicest restaurants in the East Lansing/Lansing/Okemos area, and absolutely worth a visit.

Very interesting food combinations.  I recommend highly food was delicious and highly seasoned.   This is a dining experience not a quick serve restaurant.  Half off bottles of wine on Tuesday so make a reservation.

We went to the New Year's Eve celebration at Red Haven and it was wonderful! The staff dressed up in 20s costume and did an excellent job. 

The prix fixe menu was wonderful and having 6 plates of food inspired by the 20s, was a wonderful portrait of food flavors by a creative ched. It's always special, unusual and delicious, the pallette they use is completely unexpected -- flavor combinations you wouldn't typically expect. And the wine pairings also were perfect.

Some people may think they won't be "full," but I've never left hungry -- so don't let that stop you from visiting Red Haven. Their normal menu, you can pick as many small plates as you want to share with your table. Enjoy them and enjoy the company and have a good time.

name: Boston's Restaurant & Sports Bar
address: 3301 Centre Blvd, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: First time at Bostons and very pleased with everything.  Food was good, Service was very good, And the restaurant was very clean.  Space is organized and well lit.  Not a bad spot to watch sports by any stretch.  Will probably be back for a game.  All in all, everything was very good, keep up the good work.

I have been to Bostons twice now and have enjoyed my experiences. It's a combination of a pub and a restaurant atmosphere. Great customer service, the hostess greets you with a smile and a upbeat "hello". The staff is very friendly and courteous. Food prices are reasonable and a whole lot of televisions. Try the pizza and the pull pork sandwiches, you'll love it. Take the family, go on a date; just an overall great place.

A place that looked like it might have something decent to eat, but the host's station was a ghost town. I waited for over 3 minutes for someone to acknowledge me and at least say they'd be with me in just a moment alas no? The whole time I that I waited I observed the hostess, a ways off, with her back to the front door engaged in a conversation the whole time so I left for some place interested in my business.

The food was great! I had a pulled pork burger with fries and the rest of my party had pizzas. The service was good as well. My only complaint is that they brought us pop but forgot to take the empty cups away. Still great food and service, will definitely come again

Horrible!! Okay this was my 3rd time there... So we waited for about 5 min with no hostess so we wait then finally after 10 she comes didn't apologize just says" oh" 🤔.. Ok not busy at all so i was like ok.. So she sat us down gave us menus.. We sit there for another 15 min no one comes .. 👀 to give us drinks say hello I'm your waitress waiter.. So my daughter said you wanna go i said yep lets go.. Not going back!!! I'm kinda glad this happened so she could see for her self.. Just sad!!!👎

name: Gumps BBQ
address: 1105 River St, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews:
A true and authentic BBQ joint! Gump's pulled pork breakfast tacos are a perfect balance.of smoked pork, potatoes, eggs and his signature sauces.
Every other item on the menu and his specials are better than any other BBQ place in the area, hands down!

What a great experience! Gump's catered for our company and it was not only super delicious but the customer service was outstanding - they went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. I would completely recommend. Plus, it was very affordable compared to other BBQ in Lansing. Thank you!

Best breakfast  burrito in town, come early they run out fast, I had the beef brisket sandwich, it was delicious, they also serve BBQ ribs on Friday and Saturday which are quite popular, the place is quite small, great customer service and a friendly staff, but the sides and portion size are very small, but good, the MENU items are quite pricey , normally I get the breakfast burrito, which is the best value,but they ran out of them quickly so come early ,but eating experience was excellent and I will return soon!👍👍👍👍👍👍👍🙂🙂🙂🙂🙂🍽 Had the pork breakfast Burrito,on 10-9-19 it was delicious and filling! Highly recommend it. 🙂👍🙂🍽

I enjoy this place because it's such a small business. I used to really enjoy the nachos but they moved more toward a liquid cheese that I dont love. The breakfast burritos are definitely worth stopping in for!
Friendly local place, chill vibes, and legit BBQ! Bring everyone. 💜

name: Thai Village
address: 400 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Came here on a night with my sister. Quiet cozy restaurant. Clean atmosphere. The service was quick and pleasant. The food was absolutely outstanding! Tofu Pad Pak that had so many flavors and the tofu was done perfectly. My one complaint would be that “hot” wasn’t all that hot but that’s my personal choice. If you’re in the Capitol Loop, go here. You won’t be disappointed.

So for lunch I decided to try this restaurant, and it was the best decision I made all day. The service was A1, and the staff was well trained. Food was amazing, I ordered a Pad Thai Curry that was cooked to perfection. Definitely would come back soon !

Best Thai in Lansing and Ingham County.  Casual restaurant, no frills.  As stated, it does get very busy and crowded during lunch time so we opt to go evenings and Saturdays.  Something for everyone on the menu, portions are huge too - we always leave with leftovers.

The soup we had was delicious, it seats a decent number of people, prices were cheaper than expected, and the food was good with more volume than expected. It can seat a group up to 8 easily. I would recommend this place.
This is my favorite place in all of Lansing! Great food with a casual atmosphere and friendly staff. I highly recommend Thai Village to anyone who loves Thai food!

name: Zoup!
address: 214 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Fantastic place to eat! Excellent service, let my family and I sample ALL the soups happily. Sandwiches are delicious too and the wonderful organic drinks. Very very pleased with the decision to eat here

I love Zoup because of the variety of soups they offer and their service is always the best. They always have several vegetarian options. I love that their soup menu changes daily. The staff is always very friendly and cheerful. The food tastes great. A little pricey though. A bread bowl, drink and cookie was $12.50.

Great food, but always wildly crowded during the lunch hour. They could probably have double the space and still be full. Would absolutely recommend, just prepare for little personal space during the lunch time rush.
Staff was super friendly and explained their menu. Also gave me a sample to try! Definitely a positive first experience. will definitely be coming back!

Soup was good, have to be honest. WAY!!! OVERPRICED FOR PORTIONS!!!! Welcome to low class Lansing Michigan!! Pay to park in a non existent shopping district...the only thing keeping this ghetto alive is the state office buildings nearby..this is the next Flint Michigan...how sad for the capital city of Michigan😞😞

name: Sultan's Express Lansing
address: 305 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Love the food. Owner and staff very helpful.
I've had Middle Eastern food, but this place is awesome. The chicken wasn't dry and the hummus tasted amazing. I will be back.

Love it here! One of my favorite places for Mediterranean in the area.chicken shawarma, shawarma sandwiches, fried eggplant, baklava and delicious smoothies ...yum!  Very popular with the lunch set downtown.

This is my favorite restaurant in the City of Lansing! The food here is amazing. I’ve had Middle Eastern food from MANY different restaurants in MANY different states and by far this one is the best. The owner memorized his customer’s favorites. This place is EXTREMELY busy around lunch hours being that it is located downtown. They are EXTREMELY fast! It’s worth the wait!

Fast and tasty lunch place. Nothing fancy, just good quick middle- east food. Falafel, eggplant, cauliflower, grape leaves make great vegan sandwiches. Hummus and lentil soup tasty too. Not a date-night destination, but a great spot for a filling vegan lunch.

name: Tony M's Restaurant & Banquet Center
address: 3420 S Creyts Rd, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews:
Great wrap. Great service. 
AND for quick on and off the I-69 / I-96 meeting place this was a wonderful first visit. Also, we could hear each other chat, too. Thank you. We'll be back!

We used to love this place, we went tonight after a few months and it was a joke. We ordered cheese bread and was told we had to pay an extra 75 cents if we want a cup of ranch and marina sauce. Ordered the burrito and was told it would be an extra 50 cents if I wanted sour cream. Then after paying we noticed there was a 3.5% charge to use our debt card. Crazy, we will not go back.
We got a very nice bar-style pizza, nice yeast crust, good cheese and toppings,  nicely cooked to a just browned edge.  Nice friendly staff.

My drink was good...but walking into a bar at 8:30 and seeing the chairs flipped over on most of the tables was a bit off-putting. 
I asked if they were closing and they said not till 10. It's Saturday night.? One of the waitresses said she thought they were closed at 9. It certainly isn't the place I remember from when I worked across the road.

Absolutely hands down the best place to eat in Lansing.. excellent service very family friendly atmosphere. And the food is absolutely out of this world. If you're looking for a great dining experience then look no further because Tony M's is where you need to be!!!

name: Nola Bistro
address: 603 N Waverly Rd, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews: Upon entering the restaurant was warmly greeted by two beautiful waitresses named Debbie and Ruby , they were so friendly , I felt welcome, I ordered the #2 marinated pork rice plate, it was very delicious, along with two shrimp spring rolls,  I left very satisfied, the restaurant was very clean,  definitely will be returning soon , hopefully to try the pho soups and the crepes. I highly recommend you to come try it. Definitely enjoyed my eating experience at NOLA Bistro.
Worst first experience ever. There were bones in my chicken tacos, and 2 out of 3 had long black hair in them. I ended up going to McDonald's.
Ordered Pho for take out during the "Stay home, stay safe". I was skeptical of buying pho from somewhere other than a Vietnamese restaurant. However, it was very delicious!! Five stars.
Wow - really authentic Vietnamese food. The pho is to die for!!! Sorry, food so good... it's gone before I remember to take a pic.
We went there because we know how.good their Pho and spring rolls are, and they exceeded our expectations.  Service was great and all around us was a very diverse clientele. All ages too.

name: Bangkok House
address: 420 E Saginaw St #112, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Cute and delicious place for lunch. We've tried a variety of things but the best is the chicken satay appetizer. Brown it to your liking on your own mini grill with a peanut butter dip and cucumber sauce. Service and food is great. Would recommend.

I give them a 5/5 for the quality and value of the food.  We've been to several Asian and Thai restaurants around and it's hard to find food that's actually spicy, Bankok house has been my favorite place for over 7 years! I usually get 2-3 meals from my entree, so it's a great value for me. The woman who answers the phone is awesome, she's just fast because they are so busy. If you want awesome Thai food, give them a try.

I enjoy my eating experience,  the Pad Thai with shrimp combined with extra shrimp and vegetables,  was delicious and  more than enough to satisfy my hungry appetite. I also  had chicken fried rice , which I took home, couldn't finish eating it. The service was great along with a friendly and courteous staff. Looking forward to coming back soon. 😊👍👍👍

This restaurant will surprise you. I tried it first in 2018 because I knew I liked Thai food and it is one of my favorites in Lansing. I haven't had a dish I didn't like. Also, the spice scale is normal, if you want medium, it's medium. If you want hot, it's hot. A must try if you like Thai food.
Great food in the smells are wonderful. I really like their pad Thai. The service is very fast and sometimes you feel like you are in their way. Worth a try... And very authentic.

name: SPUDS Restaurant and Greek Pastry Shop
address: 611 S Waverly Rd, Lansing, MI 48917, USA
reviews:
Great place to take the family, relaxing and the food was hot and very plenty, Bella represented the family restaurant in a professional manner, she made my family feel welcomed. Thank you Bella!
Highly recommend having a meal here.

The atmosphere was really warm and cozy.  Customer service was great, the food was good...the pancakes and eggs were great...the vegetables in the omelette were raw that was a bummer.  All in all the I would come to this place again

Last breakfast in Lansing before a move and this was a great, typical, ‘American’ diner. Had the vegetarian omelette with wheat toast and fries. Eggs in the omelette were nice and fluffy. Vegetables in the omelette tasted fresh and as someone who works in the food industry that is a tell-tale sign of quality and cleanliness. Staff was phenomenal and it was a very calm and enjoyable meal. Will be back next time I’m in Lansing!

The food was good.  Clean restuarant.   The ladies in the market area were nice.  Unfortunately our waitress was kinda rude and short with us or I would have given 5 stars.  Can't wait to try the sweet treats we picked up for later.
Great food,  I had ham,eggs, potatoes and toast, it was very delicious, the staff was very friendly and helpful and I enjoyed my eating experience at SPUDS.

name: Zoobie's Old Town Tavern
address: 1200 N Larch St, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: I love this place. Lively but not too loud, great drink selection, and the FOOD... the loaded fries are absolutely addictive and my favorite dinner is their fried goat cheese salad... YUM! Will make a return visit as soon as we're allowed to again.
Food is great. Beer list needs work - unless you're into stouts and porters and other weirdly bitter concoctions. Even of their IPAs tasted off. I like IPAs but...
Best bar/restaurant in Lansing! Get the corn fritter appetizer and pineapple prosciutto pizza and you won't be sorry. Great atmosphere and craft beer selection as well
Love going here for the "Trust Us" options, they never let me down. Let them pick the toppings on your pizza and then let them pick your drink. Sure, y'all do all the work for us. Always good!

This is technically a review for the cosmos but I ended up there on Tuesday night and sat on the zoobie's side. Went specifically for the pizza and was not disappointed! If you don't mind leaving insignificant things to chance order the trust us pizza like I did. They have some creative mules and a great beer list.

name: For Crêpe Sake
address: 221 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: What a nice break from the ordinary! First time guest sees and appreciates Crepe Sake's efforts to bringing a new taste experience to Lansing. I had the raspberry and brie crepe and hot black coffee. ☕  It was great. They serve Zingerman's coffee blends right here in Lansing. Live a little and try something New!
Friendly staff and super delicious food. We loved everything about it. It was cozy, had gluten free and vegan options that were wonderful. So glad we stopped.

Delicious, really fast service, and plenty of options for any dietary restrictions (though they do charge extra for substitutions). Atmosphere was really nice for small groups. The girl taking my order was soft spoken but super nice and the other employees made sure to make us feel welcome there. Would come here again if I lived in michigan
No place like it in Lansing. Huge variety of sweet and savory crepes. I recommend the banana crepe for breakfast.
Cozy, fast and open on Sunday. So many places in Lansing are closed on Sundays; it was nice to find this casual little place.

name: Chen's Restaurant
address: 600 E Thomas St, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: One of our favorites on the north side of Lansing. Place does not win any awards for decor, but always consistent presentation of food. Appetizer and food orders are made very quickly and always taste nice and fresh. Appears to be very popular for take-out.
I had the orange beef. It was very good. I will go again soon for more. If you are tired of ordinary meals it is good. I find many places do not fry beef with batter, like in this dish.
I order from there all the time and they are great. I have only been in there once and it was not to bad but this was a few years ago
Fast & fresh!  Imo, it's hard to get fresh Chinese food in this area.  I've visited for years and never had a bad meal.  Great prices.  The go-to for me and my other Hawaiian "ex-pats".

Huge and hot portions from friendly servers. Our go to Chinese restaurant when in the area. Crab ragoons, General Tso and Sweet & Sour Chicken are our favorites. Place is small and not anything fancy but food is fresh and fast!

name: Fleetwood Diner
address: 2211 S Cedar St, Lansing, MI 48910, USA
reviews: My dad and I were out trying to diagnose a noise in my car and decided to stop in for coffee. The food around me looked so tempting that I tried to convince him to eat, but he already had breakfast. Once we're allowed to socialize and go out again, I'm immediately returning to this place. The staff was friendly and kept our coffee topped off. The hippie hash also looked delicious. The fact that it was steadily busy and was filled with all types of people is encouraging and speaks volumes about its food and value.

Great feel... Felt like I was on a movie set. The classic look and atmosphere of the old classic diner was great. Our service was awesome. The food was amazing and price wasn't too bad. Only rating it a 3 because it's still a old diner but was a GREAT old diner. Definitely coming back.

Service was quick. Food portions are huge. My eggs for Benedict were right on. Hollandaise was mildly creamy with bright citrus flavor. Multiple styles of hash available. My man was not impressed but he ate most of his meal. Tables are small, dinner style so don't let plates pile up. Things come on plates to be served but consolidate where you can. Hot Tea came with lemon and real honey with tea bag on the side. They way it should be.

I've only ordered via Doordash. Really good food. Portions are amazing v cost. I've only tried their breakfast items and have never been disappointed. Food comes hot and fresh. Love their oatmeal. 
All of my orders have been correct with condiments and eating utensils provided.
Love this restaurant.
This place has a fun nostalgic feel to it. I got an omelette with hashbrowns inside it. I can honestly say I've never had anything like that. It was great

name: Sultan's
address: 4790 Hagadorn Rd, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
reviews: They have great Mediterranean food, but they don't have a liquor license. We didn't know that ahead of time, or we might have skipped going here for dinner and missed out on the excellent food. I had a falafel wrap that was delicious. I don't recall what my wife and out guest had, but they both enjoyed their meals too. We started with the combo appetizer I've posted a picture of. This is a family-run restaurant, which always gives a place a homey atmosphere.
The food is very authentic food. Very good. The staff was very prompt and polite. Excellent Hummus. Great job

The taste is incredible. There are some really good combos if you're looking to share a platter and save some money. I ordered the Sultan's Combo and it had a little bit of everything. It was soooo good!

Love the food but, honestly, I was pretty disappointed by the service. Ordered takeout, they said it would be 10-15 minutes. Sat down for 20 minutes. When I went up the counter, the guy started to put it together in front of me. He had to ask me again what I wanted and kept getting it wrong, like it wasn’t written down anywhere the first time. A quick In and out ended up taking longer than I thought.

A wonderful place that has been around supporting the local community for quite some time. Veg and non veg options. The veggie lunch combo was splendid. Arabic coffee - some of the best I have had in a long time. Great prices.

name: Detroit Frankie's Wood Fired Brick Oven
address: 921 N Washington Ave, Lansing, MI 48906, USA
reviews: Great pizza! Love the Wood-Fired char!  Great service, very friendly and knowledgeable! Sausage imported from Chicago is absolutely delicious! I would go here just for the pizza. 😁

Best wood fire pizza around! Available at a few locations check their website to keep current. We love visiting them at Ellison. The pizza is delicious and you can get a specialty or order whatever you like. If they are busy it could be up to an hour, remember there is only one wood fire; but in the end it’s completely worth it. So have a drink relax and play some cards with friends while u wait for that delicious pizza.
So happy Detroit Frankie's is back! Great pizza when he was at Ellison's. Bummed when he left, but happy now that it's a shorter drive. Still same great quality!
Hands down the best pizza you can buy! Make sure you say hi to the owner and staff. Absolutely great people. There's a reason why they have a cult like following. Buy this pizza!
Great pizza! Very nice group of workers! We will definitely be recommending!

name: Flap Jack Shack
address: 3000 E Grand River Ave, Lansing, MI 48912, USA
reviews: Great prices, tasty food, friendly staff, fast service, broad menu options and helpful recommendations from the staff! All around great experience here. Check out the Alaskan sourdough, its from.1975 and very tasty, but so were the pumpkin pancakes!

I had a great brunch with the family. The food was great, thanks to the Chef. However let me just say the service obviously varies by Server. We were sat down by our host who was very polite, our server took a while getting things like a menu, coffee and creamer, and then none of the food came out at the same time and the restaurant was not even that busy. Although I didnt let this bother me, it did upset my family. Would try again, but maybe find a better server next time.

Very busy on the weekends, so pack your patience. Very good over all. With the amount of people waiting and customers to be served, some of the people were a little verbal about waiting so long to place order, get served etc. Again, busy place like this means it's good food. Be patient, they do the best they can 🙂

My husband love the strawberry pancakes. I really like the fat Greek spinach omelette. The service was awesome they left the coffee pot with you. They were very responsive to your needs they asked if you wanted do you want it condiments.

Haven't been there in years, but today (during after church rush even)our order came in record time.  Our server was phenomenal and the food was delicious!  My son and I had the Energy Breakfast, I'd highly recommend it.  Egg whites, chicken breast, tomato slices and cottage cheese.  I'm not a huge egg person, or breakfast food in general, so this was a great alternative for me!

name: Midtown Brewing Co.
address: 402 S Washington Square, Lansing, MI 48933, USA
reviews: Went for lunch because I was hard craving a burger and the pics online looked good. Should have taken the time to read reviews. For downtown Lansing at noon-thirty it should have been busy. Half full. Well. Cool, I don't gotta wait. Seat myself and had a very nice server. Get the burger (well done cuz, duh, burger) and tots. Not a bad wait. Good looking burger. Nice presentation. Tots were yummy. Fresh, appropriately seasoned. Okay. I bite the burger. Eh. Just, eh. It's a thick little hunk of dry, unseasoned beef. Not bad. Not great. And dry because thoroughly cooking a thick patty dries it out. That's kind of burger 101. The bun was just barely toasted and an icky, plain one but needed more to handle the insides. The place also had a grungy feel, and not in a cool way. So, they need to get some meatier buns, toast them, discover seasonings and flatten that patty out a smidge more. Then clean that place senseless and I'd consider a re-visit. Until then, I'll walk the extra quarter mile to Wendy's.

An amazing place to have burgers and beers. Their beer list is amazing. Their burgers are amazing. Perfectly cooled and juicy. I had their olive burger. I was skeptical at first as I do not like olives, but just after my first bite, i fell in love with that burger. Their club fries is definitely something to have. I had heard that you can't stop eating those fries, and now I can second that statement.

Found this place when looking for somewhere to eat downtown. Casual and cozy. Waitstaff very friendly. Great selection of craft beers, including their own brews. Appetizers and entrees were really good. Falafel bites with dip and southwest burger were exceptional. We lucked out and got to catch stand-up comedy as well.
